0.title: Nitish Kumar resigns as Bihar CM
0.article_body: JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar met Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan on Tuesday and tendered his resignation as the state's Chief Minister. This comes after Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP. According to reports, he will stake claim to form a new government in the state with the support of Lalu Prasad Yadav's RJD.

1.title: Our party will remain with NDA: RLJP President after Bihar CM ended ties with BJP
1.article_body: After Bihar Chief Minister ended his government's alliance with BJP on Tuesday, Rashtriya Lok Janshakti Party President Pashupati Kumar Paras said his party will remain a part of NDA. "Earlier also an experiment was done between RJD & JDU but they can't stay together for long. Again such alliance is coming, it's not good sign for Bihar's development," he added.

2.title: Free education, healthcare isn't freebie, waiving off loans is: Kejriwal
2.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has filed an application in the Supreme Court, opposing a PIL against political parties promising 'freebies' during poll campaigns. "Providing free education and healthcare isn't a freebie, it's duty of any government," the party's national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said. "Waiving off ₹10 lakh crore...loans is a freebie," he added, taking a dig at the Centre.

3.title: Tree planted by Bal Thackeray falls amid rains, BMC replants it at same spot
3.article_body: A Gulmohar tree planted by Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray at Shivaji Park ground fell due to heavy rains, an official said. However, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation officials replanted the tree at the same spot. "A wider and deeper ditch was dug, root hormones were applied to the tree along with fertilisers before replantation," the BMC statement said.

4.title: 2 electrocuted, 10 hurt during procession on eve of Muharram in Guj
4.article_body: Two people died due to electrocution and 10 others were injured after they came in contact with a live electric wire during a 'Tazia' procession on the eve of Muharram in Gujarat's Jamnagar, police said on Tuesday. 'Tazia' is a miniature replica of Prophet Muhammad's grandson Imam Hussain's tomb. The injured people were admitted to a hospital, Jamnagar SP said.

5.title: Viral clip shows students hitting each other with belts at birthday party in UP hospital
5.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows some pharmacy students creating a ruckus while celebrating a birthday in a civil hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. Higher authorities have initiated an inquiry into the matter. The video shows the students hitting each other playfully with belts and running around the place.

6.title: Rana Daggubati deletes his Instagram posts days after announcing break from social media
6.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati has deleted all his posts from his Instagram account, days after he announced a "social media sabbatical". The reason behind Rana's decision to delete the posts isn't known yet. On Friday, the actor had shared a post on Twitter which read, "Work in progress!! Taking a social media sabbatical. See you at the movies, Bigger. Better. Stronger."

7.title: China closes Potala Palace after minor COVID-19 outbreak in Tibet
7.article_body: Chinese authorities on Tuesday closed Potala Palace in Tibet's Lhasa after a minor outbreak of COVID-19 was reported in the region. The reopening date for the palace would be announced later, according to an official notice. Notably, Tibet's economy is heavily dependent on tourism and the palace is a key draw.

8.title: 9 held in Faridabad for cheating 100 with fake job offers in pvt airline
8.article_body: Faridabad Police arrested nine members of a gang for allegedly cheating over 100 persons across India on the pretext of providing them with jobs in a private airline. Police recovered ₹3.22 lakh, 13 SIM cards, 12 mobile phones and laptops from the accused. "The perpetrators used to collect job seekers' data from job-related websites and placement agencies," police said.

9.title: I was body-shamed during teenage as I was overweight: Shark Tank India's Namita
9.article_body: Shark Tank India judge and Emcure Pharmaceuticals' Executive Director Namita Thapar in an interview with Chetan Bhagat revealed that she was body-shamed as a teenager as she was overweight. She said, "I wasn't like this when I was a kid...I had a lot of facial hair and acne…and I used to feel very ugly...No guy looked at me."

10.title: Man leaves hoax bomb threat letter at Faridabad Metro Station, held
10.article_body: Faridabad Police on Monday arrested a man for allegedly leaving a hoax bomb threat letter at Sarai Khwaja Metro station, police said. The accused suspected his wife was in an extramarital relationship and he wanted to frame her alleged lover for conspiring to carry out the 'blast', officers said, adding that the accused was inspired by television crime shows.

11.title: Several parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts from August 10-13
11.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts between August 10-13 from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm due to maintenance work being carried out by Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited (KPTCL). Jakkasandra, Teachers Colony and parts of Venkatapura will face power cuts on August 10. Electronics City Phase 2, Veerasandra, Doddanagamangala and surrounding areas will face power cuts from August 11-13.

12.title: Sri Lanka acts after India's protest, asks China to defer military ship visit
12.article_body: After India's protest, Sri Lanka has asked China to defer the planned visit of a Chinese ship to the island country after initially approving its arrival. The Yuan Wang 5 was due to arrive on Thursday at the Chinese-built and leased Hambantota port. India had said that it would protect its security and economic interests.

13.title: Feeling 100% physically: Top seed Medvedev ahead of 2nd round in Montreal
13.article_body: Ahead of his second round match at National Bank Open in Montreal, top seed Daniil Medvedev said he's feeling 100% fit physically and is mentally ready. The world number one won his 14th ATP title in Mexico last week. He didn't lose a set at the tournament en route to claiming his first title of the season.

14.title: Pune University to create largest online album of people holding flag
14.article_body: To celebrate 75 years of India's independence, Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) will attempt to set a world record by creating the largest online album of people holding the tricolour. "[For the] activity, we've created a...website. One has to upload a photograph [there]," an SPPU official said. SPPU plans to reach out to 5 lakh students for the initiative.

15.title: Blocking a spot for Karthik only as a finisher isn't right: Razdan
15.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Vivek Razdan said it is not right to block a spot for Dinesh Karthik in T20Is only as a finisher. "Who among Suryakumar Yadav, Virat Kohli, Deepak Hooda, Hardik Pandya can't do that job of a finisher?" added Razdan. Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth earlier stated that Karthik cannot be considered as a finisher.

16.title: We exposed BJP's 'agenda-less' monsoon session: Congress
16.article_body: A day after Parliament's monsoon session concluded ahead of its schedule, Congress party said that it exposed the BJP-led central government's "agenda-less" session, and criticised the party for "not raising important issues" in both the Houses. "Congress wanted to table rising unemployment issue...Agnipath scheme...BJP wanted to run away from discussing such matters," Congress' Gaurav Gogoi said.

17.title: MP govt to release 356 prisoners to mark 75 yrs of independence
17.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Tuesday said it will release 356 prisoners on August 15 to mark 75 years of India's independence. The prisoners, undergoing life imprisonment, will be released as per Union Home Ministry's guidelines and state government norms, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. Convicts serving jail term for serious crimes like rape won't be released, Mishra added.

18.title: 26-yr-old man stabbed to death in front of brother in Delhi, 5 held
18.article_body:
A 26-year-old man was stabbed to death in front of his brother allegedly by their neighbour and his associates, following a quarrel in Delhi's Moti Nagar area, police said on Tuesday. 
Four men have been arrested and a juvenile has been apprehended in connection with the incident, police said. The deceased was stabbed multiple times in his stomach and chest.

19.title: Nitish Kumar will remain Bihar CM if he joins Mahagathbandhan, says Congress
19.article_body: Amid speculations of a "split" between Janata Dal (United) and the Bharatiya Janata Party, Congress has said that Nitish Kumar will remain Bihar Chief Minister if he plans to join the 'Mahagathbandhan'. "If Nitish Kumar comes, we'll welcome him. If he comes, we will support him. A meeting of Mahagathbandhan is being held," Congress leader Ajit Sharma said.

20.title: Promise to fight for tribals' justice till my last breath: Rahul
20.article_body: On the occasion of the International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that he promises to fight for justice for tribals till his last breath. "For making profits, 'Hum Do, Humare Do' are plotting to snatch away the due rights of the tribal community by bringing in new laws," Rahul tweeted.

21.title: 8-year-old girl raped by 55-year-old neighbour in UP's Maharajganj
21.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her 55-year-old neighbour in Maharajganj, Uttar Pradesh. The accused allegedly lured the minor on the pretext of giving her money before committing the crime, police said. The complaint was filed after the girl narrated the incident to her family. The accused has been booked under IPC's sections 376 (rape) and 506 (criminal intimidation).

22.title: 50-yr-old Mumbai man killed during party at aviation union office, 1 held
22.article_body: A 50-year-old man, Abdul Sheikh, was allegedly beaten to death during a liquor party at an aviation union office in Mumbai's Santacruz, a police official said, adding that the accused has been arrested. As per the complainant, the incident took place on Sunday night when Sheikh intervened in a fight involving the accused Nikhil Sharma, the police official added.

23.title: 23-yr-old Mumbai entrepreneur kills self after being unable to repay loan
23.article_body: A 23-year-old entrepreneur from Mumbai allegedly died by suicide on Saturday after he was unable to repay ₹14 lakh loan he took for his start-up. Investigation has revealed that he had taken loans to start a garment store in Dadar. "In the (suicide) note, he apologised to his mother for selling her jewellery to fund his start-up," police said.

24.title: Congratulations Nitish Kumar for the leadership of a new alliance: Upendra Kushwaha
24.article_body: Upendra Kushwaha, National Parliamentary Board President of JD(U), has tweeted, "Congratulations to Shri Nitish Kumar ji for the accountability of leadership of a new coalition in a new form. Nitish ji, go ahead. The country is waiting for you." Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter also tweeted, "Get ready for the Rajtilak, Lantern bearers are returning", triggering reports of the RJD-JD(U) alliance.

25.title: Russia launches Iranian satellite into space raising spying concerns
25.article_body: Russian rocket Soyuz carrying an Iranian remote sensing satellite Khayyam launched into space from Kazakhstan's Baikonur Cosmodrome on Tuesday. Tehran has rejected claims that Moscow might use the satellite to boost intelligence capabilities in Ukraine, saying it will have full control. Last week, Washington Post reported US officials were concerned over space cooperation between Russia and Iran.

26.title: This team is a great blend: PM Modi on Maharashtra Cabinet expansion
26.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday congratulated all those who took oath as ministers in the Maharashtra government. Eighteen MLAs were sworn in as ministers in the state today. "This team is a great blend of administrative experience and the passion to deliver good governance. My best wishes to them for serving the people of the state," PM Modi said.

27.title: Dowry demand by rich persons from wife's poor family rampant: Bombay HC
27.article_body: Bombay High Court stated that the "social menace" of dowry continues despite strict legislation, adding that demand of dowry even by rich persons against poor family members of the wife is rampant. The court was hearing a plea filed by a man whose daughter died in June 2001 due to 97% burns. A sessions court had acquitted the victim's husband.

28.title: All local trains between Pune-Lonavala to resume by August-end
28.article_body: All local trains between the Pune-Lonavala section which were suspended after the COVID-19 outbreak in 2020 will resume by the end of this month. As many as 14 more trains will be added to this route, taking the total trains running between the section to 27. Eight trains were back on track on Monday.

29.title: JD(U) MLAs told Nitish 'alliance trying to weaken them' since 2020: Reports
29.article_body: Many JD(U) MLAs and MLCs reportedly told Bihar CM Nitish Kumar that their present alliance has been trying to weaken them since 2020. Without naming Lok Janshakti Party leader Chirag Paswan, they claimed that he was one such example, reports added. They also reportedly told Nitish that if they're not alert now, it won't be good for the party.

30.title: PMC chief gets notice over renaming of garden in Salisbury Park
30.article_body: The Salisbury Park Residents Forum (SPRF) has sent a notice to Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar over the illegal renaming of a corporation garden in the locality. Ex-BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale has illegally put up a board renaming the garden after his father, residents have claimed. The SPRF has threatened legal action if the board isn't removed within 15 days.

31.title: COVID cases rising in Delhi, but symptoms are mild: Arvind Kejriwal
31.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that COVID cases are rising in the national capital but there is no need to panic. "Most cases are with mild symptoms. We will take any action necessary," he added. Recently, the central government wrote to Delhi and six other states and asked them to ensure adequate testing and promote COVID-appropriate behaviour.

32.title: Snap Inc launches tool for parents to monitor teens' contacts
32.article_body: Snapchat-parent Snap Inc rolled out its first parental control tool on Tuesday, which will allow parents to see who their children are talking to, barring the conversations' substance. The feature, called 'Family Centre', will allow parents to view who their children have messaged in past seven days. However, they'll only be able to do so with their child's consent.

33.title: Woman bank manager injured in acid attack in UP's Kaushambi
33.article_body: Two bike-borne men reportedly threw acid on 33-year-old Diksha Sonkar, a senior manager in the Bank of Baroda branch at Sayd Sarawan village in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi district, on Monday. The incident took place when Sonkar was on her way to the bank on her scooter. Though her helmet protected her face, she sustained injuries on her legs and back.

34.title: Sundar Pichai, Mukesh Ambani attend The Hundred match at Lord's, Shastri shares pic
34.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani attended London Spirit's The Hundred match against Manchester Originals at Lord's. Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri shared a picture with them and wrote, "In the august company of two people who love their cricket." Shastri is currently commentating in The Hundred in England.

35.title: Ashton Kutcher was unable to see, hear due to rare disease; says 'lucky to be alive'
35.article_body: American actor Ashton Kutcher has revealed that, three years ago, he fought a "weird, super rare form of" an autoimmune disorder called Vasculitis. The disease "knocked out" his vision, hearing and equilibrium, Kutcher said, adding, "(I'm) lucky to be alive." The 44-year-old 'That '70s Show' star said it took him around a year to build his senses back up.

36.title: List shows India's sport-wise medal tally at CWG 2022
36.article_body: Out of India's 61 medals at CWG 2022 in Birmingham, 12 came from wrestling and 10 came from weightlifting. Further, India bagged seven medals in table tennis and para table tennis at the Games. India bagged the most gold medals (six) in wrestling. India won eight medals in athletics and seven in boxing.

37.title: Japanese designer Issey Miyake, known for Steve Jobs' turtlenecks, dies aged 84
37.article_body: Japanese fashion designer Issey Miyake has passed away at the age of 84 due to liver cancer. Mikaye was known for producing the signature black turtleneck of Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs. He was also famous for his pleated style of clothing that never wrinkles. Miyake was born in Hiroshima and was the survivor of the nuclear attack in 1945.

38.title: I'm told people are being paid to troll Aamir Khan: 'Laal...' director
38.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "I am told there are people being paid to troll Aamir Khan." He added, "This is deeply upsetting to hear and it's outright unfair. Why have I been trolling him for free?" This comes after the 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' trend against Aamir began on Twitter.

39.title: Kuldeep's performance vs WI has given management more problems: Manjrekar
39.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar has said Kuldeep Yadav's performance in the fifth T20I against West Indies has given more problems to the management in figuring out who would partner Yuzvendra Chahal in the spin-bowling department. "That's the problem when you try all recipes and all recipes are brilliant," he added. Kuldeep registered figures of 3/12 in the fifth T20I.

40.title: Kieron Pollard becomes first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history
40.article_body: West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard has become the first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history. Pollard achieved the feat by taking the field for London Spirit against Manchester Originals in a The Hundred match on Monday. Pollard had made his T20 debut on July 25, 2006 for Trinidad and Tobago against Cayman Islands.

41.title: Who were India's youngest and oldest medallists at CWG 2022?
41.article_body: Indian lawn bowls player Sunil Bahadur was the oldest Indian medallist at CWG 2022 at 45. His teammate Dinesh Kumar, who turned 45 in June, was the second-oldest. Paddler Sharath Kamal, 40, was the oldest Indian individual medallist. Cricketer Shafali Verma, 18, was the youngest Indian medallist, while 19-year-old wrestler Deepak Nehra was the youngest Indian individual medallist.

42.title: Bihar Assembly Speaker tests COVID-19 positive, recovers in a day amid political crisis
42.article_body: A day after he tested positive for COVID-19, Bihar Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha on Monday said his test reports have come out negative. Sinha, a BJP MLA, will play a key role in determining the legitimacy of any new alliance in the state. Earlier today, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP.

43.title: Security guard kicks pregnant woman in Pakistan, act caught on CCTV
43.article_body: A security guard in Pakistan's Karachi was seen hitting a woman who was pregnant. He has now been arrested, local media reported. CCTV footage showed the security guard arguing with the woman, after which he slapped her. As the woman fell to the ground and tried to get up, the man kicked her in the face.

44.title: Russian airlines start stripping planes for spare parts amid sanctions: Report
44.article_body: Russian airlines, including state-controlled Aeroflot, are stripping planes to secure spare parts which they can no longer buy abroad due to Western sanctions, Reuters reported. At least one Russian-made Sukhoi Superjet 100 and an Airbus A350 are reportedly currently grounded and being disassembled. An engine from one Superjet has also been removed to allow another Superjet to continue flying.

45.title: Congress to launch 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on September 7
45.article_body: The Congress party on Tuesday announced that it will launch a Kanniyakumari to Kashmir 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on September 7. It will be a foot march covering 12 states and two Union Territories, senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said. He added that the yatra will be about 3,500-km long and is expected to be completed in around 150 days.

46.title: Kenyans vote to elect new Prez amid rising cost of living, unemployment
46.article_body: Voting began in Kenya's presidential election on Tuesday, with Deputy President William Ruto and veteran opposition leader Raila Odinga as two major candidates. Kenya's 22.1 million voters will also choose senators, governors, lawmakers and woman representatives. Rising living costs, corruption, unemployment, state debt and drought are some of the election issues.

47.title: You're a mess: Arjun Kapoor on Sonam calling Brahmastra 'Shiva No. 1'
47.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor called Ranbir Kapoor's film 'Brahmastra' 'Shiva No.1' during an episode of 'Koffee With Karan', which she attended alongside actor Arjun Kapoor. "You are a mess, yaar Sonam," stated Arjun in response. Following a question over the number of friends Arjun has slept with, Sonam responded, "I am not discussing it, between my brothers there's no one left."

48.title: We are rivals, not enemies: Outgoing VP Venkaiah Naidu in Rajya Sabha
48.article_body: Outgoing Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu in Rajya Sabha said members across the political divide are rivals, not enemies. "We're not enemies, we're rivals. We must work hard to outshine others in competition...not run down others," Naidu added. "I am thankful and moved by your love and affection," Naidu stated.

49.title: Man slits wife's throat in Mumbai after she refused to settle down in village
49.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 32-year-old man for allegedly slitting the throat of his wife after she refused to return to his village. According to police, the accused, Somor Konaay, a native of West Bengal's Murshidabad, came to Mumbai in search of his wife, Adinabibi Shaikh, who came to Mumbai in search of a job. The couple got married this year.

50.title: Bharti Airtel Q1 net profit surges 466%, revenue jumps 22%
50.article_body: Bharti Airtel on Monday posted a 466% surge in its consolidated net profit to ₹1,607 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹284 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The telecom service provider's consolidated revenue jumped by 22% year-on-year to ₹32,805 crore. Its stock closed 0.18% higher at ₹705 on the National Stock Exchange on Monday.

51.title: Chennai Petroleum cuts crude processing by 25% at Manali refinery
51.article_body: Chennai Petroleum Corporation said on Tuesday that it had cut crude processing at its 2,01,000 barrels per day Manali refinery in Chennai by 25%. This followed an order by the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board after residents from the area near the refinery complained of liquefied petroleum gas-like odour. The company said it is confident of resolving the issue soon.

52.title: 2 more grain-carrying ships sail from Ukrainian port: Turkey
52.article_body: Two more grain-carrying ships sailed from Ukraine's Chornomorsk port on Tuesday, Turkey's Defence Ministry said. The Ocean Lion, carrying 64,720 tonnes of corn, departed for South Korea and the Rahmi Yagci, carrying 5,300 tonnes of sunflower meal, departed for Istanbul. The shipment is part of deal signed between Russia and Ukraine after warnings of food shortages in parts of world.

53.title: Punjab farmers block highway over pending cane arrears worth ₹72 cr
53.article_body: Farmers on Monday began an indefinite protest by blocking a national highway in Punjab's Phagwara over delays in payment of arrears worth ₹72 crore to cane growers. While protesters only blocked one side of highway, they threatened to stop movement on the other side too if arrears weren't cleared. Protest is being held under banner of Bharti Kisan Union (Doaba).

54.title: Oil prices slightly fall amid 2015 Iran nuclear deal revival talks
54.article_body: Oil prices marginally declined on Tuesday amid talks to revive the 2015 Iran nuclear deal with the Brent futures falling 14 cents to $96.51 a barrel. The West Texas Intermediate crude futures declined 16 cents to $90.60 a barrel. On Monday, the European Union put forward a "final" text to revive the nuclear deal, awaiting approvals from Washington and Tehran.

55.title: Get ready for 'Rajtilak', tweets Lalu's daughter triggering reports of JD(U)-RJD alliance
55.article_body: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter Rohini Acharya on Tuesday tweeted, "Get ready for the Rajtilak (coronation), Lantern bearers are returning", triggering reports of an alliance between RJD and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's party JD(U). Nitish Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP earlier today. He will meet the Governor at 4 pm, according to ANI.

56.title: Factory line upgrades disrupt Tesla's China-made car sales in July
56.article_body: Tesla sold 28,217 Chinese-made vehicles in July as against 78,906 vehicles in June as production was disrupted by a scheduled upgrade to its factory lines in Shanghai. The upgrade aims to raise the factory's weekly output to around 22,000 units compared to around 17,000 units in June. Tesla exported 19,756 Model 3s and Model Ys from China last month.

57.title: 7 dead in Seoul and surrounding areas amid record rainfall
57.article_body: At least five people died in South Korean capital Seoul and two in the neighbouring Gyeonggi Province amid torrential rain. According to the Korean Meteorological Administration, southern part of Seoul received 100mm of rain per hour on Monday, while some parts received 141.5mm of rain, worst in 80 years. The rain knocked out power and left roads and subways submerged.

58.title: JSW’s July crude steel production rises by 14% to 15.6 lakh tonne
58.article_body: JSW Steel reported a 14% year-on-year growth in crude steel production on a standalone basis at 15.69 lakh tonne for July. Its flat rolled products' production expanded by 15% to 10.72 lakh tonne from 9.34 lakh tonne in July 2021, while that for long items rose by 10% to 3.65 lakh tonne from 3.06 lakh tonne in the year-ago period.

59.title: Reliance Industries created 2.32 lakh jobs in FY22 led by retail arm
59.article_body: According to Reliance Industries' integrated annual report, the company added 2.23 lakh jobs in FY 2021-22, taking the total workforce to 3.43 lakh at the end of FY22. The retail arm added 1.68 lakh jobs while Jio employed 57,883 people. Jio, that added 130 million customers in FY22, completed 5G coverage strategy for top 1,000 cities with 100% indigenous technology.

60.title: Binance sent Apple Watches to all of us last year: WazirX ex-employee
60.article_body: A former WazirX employee told Moneycontrol that Binance sent Apple Watches to all employees of the Indian cryptocurrency exchange during their anniversary last year. "We always thought that Binance owned WazirX," said the employee, amid a spat between the two exchanges over WazirX's ownership. The employee also said that WazirX didn't allot ESOPs to its staff, unlike other Indian exchanges.

61.title: Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial to be explored in 'Law & Order: SVU'
61.article_body: The defamation trial between actors Johnny Depp and Amber Heard will be explored in an episode of the upcoming season of television series 'Law & Order: Special Victims Unit'. Pictures from the episode's shooting are being compared to the pictures of Heard taken outside the Virginia courthouse. Depp won the trial against Heard over her claim of surviving domestic abuse.

62.title: Talk about it, don't jump to conclusions: Rashmika on rumours of dating Vijay
62.article_body: Addressing rumours of dating actor Vijay Deverakonda, actress Rashmika Mandanna said that her fans can talk about it but they shouldn't jump to conclusions until she says it in her own words. The actress further said, "Sometimes I am like...I am doing five films a year but you are still coming and asking me, 'Who are you dating?'"

63.title: Cell therapy firm Eyestem raises $6.4 mn in Series A funding round
63.article_body: Bengaluru-based firm Eyestem secured $6.4 million in Series A funding round, taking its valuation to $46.4 million. The round was led by three pharmaceutical companies Biological E, Alkem Laboratories and Natco and saw the participation of existing investors Endiya Partners and Kotak Private Equity. "We'll remain focused on solidifying our cell therapy platform," Eyestem CEO said.

64.title: PNB scam-accused pays ₹7.5 lakh for recording Bombay HC proceedings
64.article_body: Vipul Ambani, the former CFO of PNB scam-accused Nirav Modi, paid ₹7.5 lakh cost towards the Bombay High Court library after being caught recording court proceedings. The court seized two mobile phones and airpods from him. Ambani tendered an apology saying he will not indulge in any such activities in any court proceedings in any court of law in India.

65.title: Cab driver steals woman's SIM, transfers ₹3.4 lakh in B'luru; arrested
65.article_body: The Bengaluru police on Monday arrested a cab driver for allegedly swapping SIM and siphoning money from a woman's bank account. The accused had reportedly used the SIM to activate victim's Unified Payments Interface (UPI) and other payment apps. He then transferred ₹3.45 lakh to his account and purchased a mobile phone and a scooter from the money, reports said.

66.title: WhatsApp to now allow users to leave groups silently, choose 'Online' status viewers
66.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has announced new privacy features for WhatsApp. Users will now be able to choose who they want to share their 'Online' status with. They will soon not be able to take screenshots of a 'View Once' message if the sender chooses to block it. Users will now be able to exit groups silently, without notifying others.

67.title: 2 passengers rob cab driver of phone, earpiece & cash in Pune; held
67.article_body: Two people were arrested after they allegedly hired a cab through a ridesharing platform and then robbed the 42-year-old driver of his phone, earpiece and cash on Monday in Pune's Hinjewadi. The passengers reportedly attacked the driver after asking him to stop the cab on the roadside. The duo was arrested within hours of the incident, police said.

68.title: Authorities forced me to quit as student saw my swimsuit pics: St Xavier's University teacher
68.article_body: A former assistant professor at St Xavier's University, Kolkata, has alleged that university authorities forced her to quit after a parent complained that he had noticed his son looking at photos of her in a swimsuit on Instagram, The Wire reported. The teacher said authorities told her it was "objectionable to put up...posts which might corrupt minds of young men".

69.title: Never expected to draw flak on 'Kesariya': Lyricist Amitabh Bhattacharya
69.article_body: Amitabh Bhattacharya, who is the lyricist of the song 'Kesariya', has said that the song being trolled was unexpected. "We never expected to draw flak on the words 'love storiyaan'...It's a modern film and not a mythological film," he added. Amitabh stated, "The characters belong to this generation...there can be a Hinglish word, that was our attempt."

70.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar ends alliance with BJP
70.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar ended his government's alliance with partner BJP on Tuesday. This comes days after Bihar leader RCP Singh quit the Janata Dal (United). Former Union Minister RCP Singh resigned from the JD(U) after his own party sent him a notice over corruption allegations.

71.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar to meet Governor Phagu Chauhan today at 4 pm
71.article_body: Bihar CM and Janata Dal (United) leader Nitish Kumar will meet Governor Phagu Chauhan on Tuesday at 4 pm at Raj Bhavan. Earlier, reports claimed that Nitish has sought time to meet the Governor today. This comes amid reported tensions in the coalition between JD(U) and BJP. JD(U) and the Opposition RJD have called for separate meetings of their MLAs.

72.title: Karthik will probably be a reserve batter: Kris Srikkanth on Asia Cup
72.article_body: Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth said Dinesh Karthik will probably be a reserve batter for Team India in the upcoming Asia Cup 2022. "I doubt...he will be in the XI," he added. Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja stated he doesn't see Karthik being picked in the lineup for T20 World Cup 2022 if India play with an aggressive approach.

73.title: Pardes was offered to Madhuri, realised won't get innocence from a star: Ghai
73.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai revealed that Madhuri Dixit was offered 'Pardes' first, adding she liked the story. "Madhuri was already a big star by that time. People in my office...suggested we take her," he stated. Ghai added, "But [the character]...has the innocence of an adolescent girl. I realised I wouldn't get that innocence from a star...a newcomer would easily do it."

74.title: Noida authority sent notices to Tyagi before, but there was no action: Residents
74.article_body: The apartment owners' association (AOA) of Noida's Grand Omaxe society had made a complaint to Noida authority in 2019 about politician Shrikant Tyagi for trying to encroach upon the common area, society's AOA president Avinash Mathur said. Tyagi enjoyed a free run for at least three years, reported HT quoting sources. Illegal construction at Tyagi's residence was demolished on Monday.

75.title: Not comfortable with intimate scenes, had to be convinced: Madhurima
75.article_body: Actress Madhurima Tuli has stated that she is not comfortable doing intimate scenes onscreen, adding that she had to be convinced for the romantic scenes in music video 'Hayaa'. 'Hayaa' was directed by her brother Shrikant Tuli. "The scenes in 'Hayaa' were not really vulgar...They were...sensuous in a good way. There was also no kissing or love-making," the actress added.

76.title: Govt declares assets of PM Modi, movable assets increase to ₹2.23 crore
76.article_body: The Prime Minister's Office has declared PM Narendra Modi's assets, which showed that his movable assets increased by ₹26.13 lakh during 2021-22 to ₹2,23,82,504. This includes a fixed deposit, bank balance, life insurance policies and jewellery among other things. It also stated that he no longer owns any immovable property after donating his share in a residential plot in Gujarat.

77.title: Salman Khan is lot like me, he has grown up looking at me: Jackie Shroff
77.article_body: Actor Jackie Shroff has said that actor Salman Khan is a lot like him. "The way he dresses, walks and speaks. You know, he has grown up looking at me, I think," he added. "I don't have anyone like Salman Khan in my life...but with Salman, I feel he is mine. I see myself in him," Jackie further stated.

78.title: We're not making this debate, media is: Alia on north-south cinema
78.article_body: Speaking about the north-south cinema debate, actress Alia Bhatt stated that members of the film industry are not making the debate but the media is. "We're very happy and we want to work with each other. Please let us and don't debate," she added. Alia further said that there is some unnecessary attention and scrutiny on the Hindi film industry.

79.title: If I were the selector, Shami would've been in squad for Asia Cup: Srikkanth
79.article_body: Ex-chief selector Kris Srikkanth has said if he were the current chairman of the selection committee, then Mohammad Shami would've been included in India's squad for the upcoming Asia Cup. "We are going with one medium pacer short. Two wrist spinners are fine. I feel bad for Axar Patel, who has missed out. I'm happy for Deepak Hooda," he added.

80.title: Zero on ground, want to become hero by giving 'revadis': BJP on Kejriwal’s remark
80.article_body: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia reacted to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's "freebies" remark. "Responding to his (Kejriwal) press conference, the people of…India are saying that those who are zeroes at the ground level, want to become heroes by distributing 'revadis'," Bhatia added. "There are some people who call the provision of free education...as 'revadi' or 'freebies'," Kejriwal had said.

81.title: Pune-based businessman seeking petrol pump licence cheated of ₹42 lakh
81.article_body: A Pune-based businessman, seeking a petrol pump licence, was cheated of ₹42 lakh, police said. The victim in July had filed a form on a website that offered a fuel dispensing licence from a petroleum company. The complainant gave ₹42 lakh to the accused via multiple online transactions after he was informed that his application had been approved, police added.

82.title: Can't predict what will happen today: Bihar minister Shahnawaz Hussain
82.article_body: Bihar BJP minister Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said that he cannot predict what will happen in Bihar on Tuesday. "I'm a state minister...attending the investors' summit was important for me. If I hadn't attended it, how would Bihar have been perceived?" Hussain added. CM Nitish Kumar's JD(U) and the Opposition RJD have called for separate meetings of their MLAs in Patna.

83.title: Arvind Kejriwal to visit North Gujarat tomorrow
83.article_body: AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal will be visiting North Gujarat on August 10 ahead of Assembly polls that are slated to be held later this year. “Kejriwal will hold Town Hall in Palanpur that will be attended by people from all walks of life,” said AAP spokesperson. This will be his 10th visit to the state in last four months.

84.title: PM Modi remembers Prophet Muhammad’s grandson on Muharram
84.article_body: On the occasion of Muharram, Prime Minister Modi remembered the sacrifices of Prophet Muhammad's grandson Hazrat Imam Hussain. “Today is a day to recall the sacrifices of Hazrat Imam Hussain (AS). He is remembered for his unwavering commitment to truth and his fight against injustice. He also placed great importance on equality and brotherhood,” said PM Modi.

85.title: 7-yr-old boy drowns in canal in Gurugram; NDRF holds search ops
85.article_body: A seven-year-old boy allegedly drowned in an overflowing canal at a village in Gurugram. A station house officer said that a team of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) has taken over the search operations on Tuesday, adding, "Monday's search operation continued till 8 pm but neither the boy, [nor] his body could be found." The incident occurred on Sunday.

86.title: India's Sharath Kamal wins more gold medals than 56 countries at CWG 2022
86.article_body: India's 40-year-old table tennis player Sharath Kamal bagged more gold medals than 56 nations/territories at CWG 2022. He won a total of three gold medals at the Games. Out of the 72 countries/territories that took part in CWG 2022, only 16 bagged three or more gold medals. Sharath has bagged seven gold medals in CWG history.

87.title: Volcanic eruption in Tonga blew 58,000 swimming pools of water into the atmosphere
87.article_body: The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai submarine volcano eruption shot 38 billion gallons of water into the atmosphere, enough to fill 58,000 Olympic swimming pools, according to a new study published in the journal Geophysical Research Letters. The study was led by NASA scientist Luis Millán. The January 15 eruption was one of the largest recorded in the past 140 years.

88.title: What an incredible CWG it has been for us, congratulations to all: Sania Mirza
88.article_body: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza has congratulated the country's Commonwealth Games contingent for their performance in the 2022 Birmingham Games. "What an incredible CWG it has been for us...congratulations to the entire contingent...entire country is so proud of you," tweeted Mirza. India finished on the fourth position with 61 medals, including 22 golds, at CWG 2022.

89.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging in parts of Hyd, traffic affected
89.article_body: Heavy rainfall lashed Hyderabad on Tuesday morning, causing waterlogging and traffic jams across several parts of the city. The area of Bahadurpura received the maximum rainfall at 9.1 mm, followed by 8.3 mm of rainfall in Charminar and 8 mm of rainfall in Golconda. According to India Meteorological Department (IMD), Hyderabad is expected to witness rainfall till August 12.

90.title: 4 AMU students suspended for violence, attack on other students
90.article_body: Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) on Monday suspended four students following charges of violence and attack on other students. The university had received two complaints, AMU Proctor said. One complainant claimed that three students had physically assaulted and attempted to kidnap him, while the other complainant alleged that a student had attempted to kill him by opening fire, the Proctor added.

91.title: 29 people arrested in cases related to Ponzi schemes since 2019: Govt
91.article_body: About 29 people have been arrested in cases related to Ponzi schemes since 2019, Centre informed the Lok Sabha on Monday. Out of these, the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) arrested 21 people from 2019 to June 2022, said Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad. Further, eight were arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in last three years, Karad added.

92.title: All 16 BJP ministers in Bihar to resign today, seek meeting with Governor: Report
92.article_body: After Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, the BJP has sought time for a meeting with Governor Phagu Chauhan today, reports said. All 16 BJP ministers in the state cabinet will tender their resignations to the Governor on Tuesday, reports added. Earlier today, Bihar BJP leaders met at Deputy CM Tarkishore Prasad's residence.

93.title: We make same mistakes again and again: Harmanpreet on CWG final loss vs Aus
93.article_body: Following India Women's nine-run loss against Australia in the gold medal match at CWG 2022, captain Harmanpreet Kaur said, "Every time in big finals, we make the same mistakes again and again (with the bat)." "That's something we've to improve," added Harmanpreet. "We could've easily won gold," she stated. India lost eight wickets for 34 runs while chasing 162.

94.title: Table hit Aamir's chest, he had hairline fracture in ribs: Actor on 'Laal...'
94.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' actor Harry Parmar said that a table hit actor Aamir Khan's chest during a fight sequence in the movie. "Aamir was to charge upon me and we had to fall down on a bar table. The camera angle was such that we could not have any padding...He even had a hairline fracture in the ribs," he added.

95.title: Kerala HC gives a week to NHAI to fix all potholes
95.article_body: Kerala HC has directed the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to take immediate steps to rectify every road under their purview within a week. It also asked the authorities to take necessary action against contractors, engineers responsible for pothole-ridden roads. The court also noted that the District Collectors cannot be mere spectators and react solely when an accident happens.

96.title: 5 of family killed as car rams into truck from rear in Andhra Pradesh
96.article_body: At least five members of a family were killed when a car they were travelling in rammed into a truck from the rear on Amaravati-Anantapur highway in Andhra Pradesh's Prakasam on Monday, police said. "The car was being driven at a high speed...driver failed to notice the truck going on at a slow pace at a road curve," police added.

97.title: If he is ready for the reaction then why not: Sonu on Ranveer's nude photoshoot
97.article_body: Speaking about actor Ranveer Singh's nude pictures for Paper Magazine, actor Sonu Sood said that it's an individual's choice to do a photoshoot the way they want. He further said that we live in a world where people point fingers at you so you need to get ready for such reactions. "So...if someone is ready then why not?" Sonu added.

98.title: Father, son who killed black man in US get life sentence for hate crime
98.article_body: The father and son, who killed unarmed black man Ahmaud Arbery in February 2020 in a Georgia neighbourhood, have each received a second life sentence on Monday for committing federal hate crimes. Travis McMichael and his father Greg McMichael were earlier sentenced to life without parole in a state court. Arbery was killed while he was jogging.

99.title: 3 more arrested for assaulting policeman inside police station in Delhi
99.article_body: Days after a video went viral showing a group of men assaulting a Delhi Police head constable inside Anand Vihar police station, the Delhi Police arrested three more persons in connection with the case. Police had earlier arrested advocate Satish Kumar, brother of prime accused Ajay, and extended his police custody for a day for identification of other suspects.

100.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar seeks time to meet Governor amid tensions with BJP: Report
100.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has sought time to meet Governor Phagu Chauhan today, reports claimed. This comes after Nitish Kumar's JD(U) and the Opposition RJD called separate meetings of their MLAs in Patna. RJD leaders began arriving at party chief Lalu Prasad Yadav's residence on Tuesday morning and were asked to hand over their mobile phones ahead of the meeting.

101.title: Defence Expo to be held in Gandhinagar from Oct 18
101.article_body: The Ministry of Defence has announced to hold Defence Expo in Gandhinagar from October 18 to 22. The theme for this edition is ‘Path to Pride’, invoking nationalistic pride and encouraging citizens to take part in nation-building. The exhibition is in line with the vision of PM Modi to achieve self-reliance and achieve export of $5 billion by 2025.

102.title: Both Pant and Karthik will play in my XI: Kiran More on India's XI for Asia Cup
102.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Kiran More has said both wicketkeepers Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik should be included in Team India's playing XI in the Asia Cup. "I will probably sit out Deepak Hooda from the team and play with Hardik Pandya, Pant, Karthik and Jadeja," stated More. India's squad for the upcoming Asia Cup was announced on Monday.

103.title: Delhi Police busts gang making spurious engine oil, 7 arrested
103.article_body: Delhi Police has busted a gang that was manufacturing and selling spurious lubricating engine oil and arrested seven people, including the factory's owner. The factory owner worked in an oil company previously and learnt about the trade while employed there. Police recovered counterfeit engine oil and five 200-litre drums of used raw engine oil among other goods worth ₹14 lakh.

104.title: Those responsible for sinkhole to face 'consequences': Chile
104.article_body: Chilean Mining Minister said that the country will apply sanctions on those responsible for a huge sinkhole near a copper mine. The sinkhole, 36.5 metres in diameter that opened in late July, triggered mobilisation of local authorities and suspension of operations by Canadian company Lundin. Fines tend to be insignificant, ruling must be exemplary to mining companies, Mining Minister added.

105.title: US-based firm Twilio suffers data breach after hackers trick staff via phishing attack
105.article_body: US-based cloud communications company Twilio said that hackers accessed its customer data after "fooling some employees into providing their credentials" via an SMS phishing attack. It said that the hackers used the stolen credentials to gain access to internal systems, following which they launched an investigation. Twilio has more than 1,50,000 corporate customers, including Airbnb and Uber.

106.title: Not just Haryana MLAs, those from Punjab, Delhi received threats too: Vij
106.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said that investigations have found that not just MLAs from Haryana but three legislators from Punjab and two from Delhi also received threat calls recently. Vij added that a special task force of Haryana Police arrested six people for allegedly making extortion calls to some MLAs of the state and also giving them death threats.

107.title: India should thank Mukesh Ambani for digitisation in the country: Jhunjhunwala
107.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala has said that India should thank Mukesh Ambani for the change he has brought about in the country. "The low cost of communication, whether in voice or in data, has caused digitisation in India," Jhunjhunwala told CNBC-TV18 in an interview. "This country has to remain eternally grateful to Ambani," he added.

108.title: He apologises even if I lose a point: Sreeja Akula on Sharath Kamal
108.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula said CWG 2022 gold medallist and her mixed doubles partner Sharath Kamal apologises if she loses a point. 40-year-old Kamal trained in Chennai during the break due to COVID-19. "With the kind of routine we have had during CWG 2022, I would've been dead...two days ago (if it wasn't for improved fitness)," said Kamal.

109.title: 1,515 security personnel deployed for 464 protectees: Haryana govt
109.article_body: The Haryana government informed the state Assembly that it has deployed at least 1,515 security personnel for the personal security of 464 protectees, including MLAs and MPs of the state. At least 523 police personnel have been deputed to guard 316 persons/leaders related to various categories, the Haryana government said in response to a question of MLA Abhay Singh Chautala.

110.title: Not job of court to declare Hindus as a minority in states: SC
110.article_body: It is not the job of a court to declare Hindus as a minority in states where they are outnumbered by other communities, Supreme Court said. "There cannot be a general declaration...unless you show us something concrete about denial of rights," it added. Pleas seeking guidelines for the identification of minorities at district levels are "contrary" to law, SC stated.

111.title: Politician Tyagi who pushed and abused woman on camera arrested near Noida
111.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi who was seen abusing and pushing a woman on camera at a society in Noida has been arrested. Noida administration had on Monday demolished illegal construction at the residence of Tyagi in Grand Omaxe in Noida's Sector 93. Earlier, the BJP had said Tyagi is "not a party worker".

112.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi who assaulted Noida woman has 9 cases against him since 2007
112.article_body: According to Uttar Pradesh Police, a total of nine cases have been registered against politician Shrikant Tyagi since 2007. The cases range from extortion and criminal intimidation to rioting and violence. In 2020, he was booked in a case of attempted murder and criminal intimidation. Two more FIRs were filed against Tyagi after he abused and pushed a Noida woman.

113.title: Govt didn't have legislative agenda: Jairam as Monsoon Session ends before schedule
113.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said during Parliament's Monsoon Session, the government did not have much of a legislative agenda. "This time around the government didn't seem to have the appetite for continuing the session till Friday, with two holidays in between," Ramesh said on being asked about the Monsoon Session which ended ahead of the schedule, The Indian Express reported.

114.title: 18 MLAs sworn-in as ministers in Maharashtra Cabinet expansion
114.article_body: Eighteen MLAs were sworn-in as ministers in Maharashtra on Tuesday. They included Chandrakant Patil, Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, Sudhir Mungantiwar, Suresh Khade, Girish Mahajan, Ravindra Chavhan, Mangal Prabhat Lodha, Vijaykumar Gavit, Atul Save, Dada Bhuse, Shambhuraj Desai, Sandipan Bhumare, Uday Samant, Tanaji Sawant, Abdul Sattar, Deepak Kesarkar, Gulabrao Patil and Sanjay Rathod.

115.title: Vijay's muscle imbalances were too extreme: Trainer on preparing for Liger
115.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda's trainer Kuldep Sethi said the imbalances of his muscles were "too extreme" which had to be considered during Vijay's training for 'Liger'. "His rotator cuffs are very weak....Before he came to me, his...training was wrong," added Sethi. "We started training in January 2020...Then in March 2020, the lockdown happened...2020 was a big mess," he stated.

116.title: Post of governor must be abolished in India: West Bengal minister
116.article_body: The post of the governor must be abolished in a country like India where the political situation is very diversified and different parties rule different states, West Bengal minister Sobhandeb Chattopadhyay said on Monday. The responsibilities of the post should be handed over to the Chief Justice of the High Court, Chattopadhyay stated.

117.title: Doctors told me my chance of survival was 30%: Sonali on her cancer battle
117.article_body: Sonali Bendre recalled her battle with cancer and revealed the doctors told her that her chance of survival was 30%. "At one point, Goldie (Behl) sent me a photo of a newspaper's headline stating that after my news came out...the testing went up...many people went up to get tested," she added. Sonali was diagnosed with stage four cancer in 2018.

118.title: Administrative secretaries take House business casually: Haryana Speaker
118.article_body: Haryana Assembly Speaker Gian Chand Gupta wrote to CM Manohar Lal Khattar claiming that some of the administrative secretaries are taking legislative business casually which amounts to "disrespect to the House". "It has been observed...most of the administrative secretaries do not attend the House proceedings. They leave the officers' gallery as (soon as) the CM leaves the House," Gupta added.

119.title: WhatsApp now allows users to delete messages 2 days after they were sent
119.article_body: WhatsApp users now have over two days to delete their sent messages instead of just one hour, announced the company on Tuesday. Users will now have two days and 12 hours to delete a sent message while the earlier limit was 68 minutes. Users can delete the message just for themselves or request that messages be deleted for everyone.

120.title: China preparing for invasion: Taiwan
120.article_body: Taiwan's Foreign Minister Joseph Wu has said China is using military drills it launched in protest against US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit as an excuse to prepare for an invasion of the self-ruled island. "It's conducting...missile launches as well as cyber attacks, a disinformation campaign and economic coercion in an attempt to weaken public morale in Taiwan," Wu added.

121.title: Co-worker stabs UP man in nose with pen, ruptures windpipe; kills him
121.article_body: A 23-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh died after his co-worker stabbed him in the nose with a pen during an argument in Punjab. "Amit [the victim] and Lakhan [the accused] were consuming liquor...While drinking, they had heated arguments and in a fit of rage, Lakhan stabbed Amit in the nose with a pen, rupturing the windpipe," police said.

122.title: 25-year-old man shoots self dead over domestic issues in Pune
122.article_body: A 25-year-old man allegedly shot himself dead using a country-made pistol in Pune's Hadapsar, police said on Monday. The deceased was depressed over some domestic issues and no suicide note has been found, an official said. The incident came to light after the deceased's family members broke open his house's door and found his body, the official further said.

123.title: Earned a lot after 'Gully Boy': Vijay on report of parents' reaction to 'Darlings'
123.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma reacted to a news portal sharing a tweet stating that the success of 'Darlings' assured the actor's parents that he won't die hungry. Vijay shared the tweet, writing, "Ye toh maine Gullyboy ke liye bola tha...uske baad bahot paisa kamaya hai bhai (I said this for 'Gully Boy'. After that I earned a lot of money)."

124.title: No special treatment after violating law: Delhi HC to sex worker
124.article_body: Delhi High Court refused to grant interim bail to a sex worker accused of trafficking minor girls. It stated that a sex worker is entitled to all rights available to a citizen but cannot claim any special treatment. The accused was arrested last year and sought at least a week's interim bail claiming her mother required urgent knee replacement surgery.

125.title: Google services back up after brief global outage
125.article_body: Google services are back online after a brief outage that affected thousands of users globally, as per outage tracking website Downdetector.com. Several users had reported being shown an 'Error 500 (Server Error)' message while using Google Search amid the outage. The outage had also impacted the firm's other products including Google Photos and Google Maps.

126.title: Actor Ezra Miller charged with burglary for stealing alcohol from a home in US
126.article_body: Actor Ezra Miller has been charged with felony burglary in the US, according to a report from the Vermont State Police. The 29-year-old 'Flash' star was charged in connection to the theft of "several bottles of alcohol" from within a residence while the homeowners were not present. Miller has been arrested twice this year, for disorderly conduct and second-degree assault.

127.title: Karthik can have a seat beside me as commentator in T20 WC: Ajay Jadeja
127.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said if Team India plays with an "aggressive" approach in the upcoming T20 World Cup, then wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has "no work" in Australia. "Karthik can have a seat beside me...But there...I'd not pick him," he stated. Jadeja, however, also added if India go the MS Dhoni way, selectors will have to pick Karthik.

128.title: 'Masoom Sawaal' film poster shows Lord Krishna's pic on sanitary pad, FIR filed
128.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have filed an FIR against film 'Masoom Sawaal' director Santosh Upadhyay and the entire team for allegedly hurting religious sentiments on the complaint of Hindu Rashtra Navnirman Sena President Amit Rathore. The complainant alleged that the producer has used a picture of Lord Krishna on sanitary pads in a poster which can flare up communal riots.

129.title: Really heartbroken: Rasquinha on India's 0-7 loss vs Aus in CWG final
129.article_body: Reacting to the Indian men's hockey team losing their gold medal match 0-7 against Australia at CWG 2022, ex-Indian men's hockey team captain Viren Rasquinha tweeted, "Really heartbroken." "Was so tough to do live commentary when the team you love...is losing 0-7," he added. Rasquinha earlier stated that India's indiscipline in the 4-4 draw against England was "inexcusable".

130.title: It's time we fight divisive forces and restore unity of nation: KCR
130.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) on Monday asked people to be wary of "divisive forces" trying to divide the country on communal lines. "It's time all of us fight these divisive forces and restore...unity and integrity of the nation, to uphold the prestige of India," KCR said. He was addressing a gathering at the Hyderabad International Convention Centre.

131.title: 4 women rescued, 2 missing after boat capsizes in river in Assam
131.article_body: Four women were rescued and two others went missing after a boat they were travelling in capsized in the Ghiladhari river in Assam's Biswanath on Monday.  According to police, the six women were returning home after work when the incident took place. Biswanath SP said that SDRF has been informed, adding, "We're arranging lights for...search and rescue operation at night."

132.title: 'Grease' actress Olivia Newton-John passes away aged 73
132.article_body: Actress and Grammy-winning singer Olivia Newton-John has passed away at the age of 73 at her southern California ranch, her husband John Easterling said. "Olivia has been a symbol of triumphs and hope for over 30 years sharing her journey with breast cancer," he wrote. She is known for her role as Sandy in 1978 film 'Grease'.

133.title: Is the state functioning as 'Mamata Gymkhana': Pralhad Joshi
133.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi criticised TMC leader Derek O'Brien for his tweet, which alleged that the Centre is turning Parliament into “Gujarat Gymkhana”. Joshi tweeted, “The people of Bengal elected BJP as the main Opposition but TMC, in its arrogance, has denied BJP the post of PAC Chairman.” Raising questions he added, “Is the state functioning as a Mamata Gymkhana?”

134.title: No rift in JD(U)-BJP ties, says Upendra Kushwaha
134.article_body: Janata Dal (United) leader Upendra Kushwaha on Monday dismissed speculations about a rift between BJP and JD(U). “Yes absolutely...everything is fine in the NDA alliance...Today we are not making any claim but Nitish Kumar has all the qualifications to become the Prime Minister,” said Kushwaha.

135.title: Building's parapet wall collapses in Punjab; 1 dead, 3 injured
135.article_body: A 46-year-old man has died and three others, including an eight-year-old boy, were injured after a building's parapet wall collapsed at Gill Road in Punjab's Ludhiana. Following the incident, labourers tried to pelt stones at the investigating police officers, however, the officers managed to pacify them. According to the injured boy's mother, the building was in shoddy condition.

136.title: Shrikant Tyagi used to misbehave with kids, break their bats: Report
136.article_body: Shrikant Tyagi, who had abused and assaulted a woman in a society in Noida used to misbehave with children too, reports said. Tyagi, who identifies himself on social media as national executive member of BJP's Kisan Morcha, used to break the bats of the children and forbade them from cycling, reports added.

137.title: Amid speculations of split with BJP, JD(U) to hold key meeting today
137.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has called for key meeting of all MPs and MLAs of Janata Dal (United) on Tuesday. This comes amid speculations of party's "split" with the Bharatiya Janata Party. Kumar had also met the state Deputy Chief Minister and BJP leader Tarkishore Prasad on Monday. The Chief Minister had also recently skipped the Niti Aayog meeting.

138.title: Once was told it's not my fight when I supported someone: Kashyap
138.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, speaking about the 'lack of unity in the film industry' comment by filmmaker Mukesh Bhatt, has said that the industry is like that. "This one time I stood in support of someone else...I was told it's not my fight, my place to talk and that I should shut up," he said. Anurag's directorial 'Dobaaraa' features Taapsee Pannu.

139.title: Pfizer to buy Global Blood Therapeutics for $5.4 billion
139.article_body: Pfizer Inc on Monday said that it would buy Global Blood Therapeutics for about $5.4 billion in cash and "the acquisition would boost its capabilities in rare haematology". Global Therapeutics makes Oxbryta tablets for the treatment of sickle cell disease. In May, Pfizer acquired Biohaven for $11.6 billion; in December 2021, it announced a $6.7 billion acquisition of Arena Pharmaceuticals.

140.title: Partha has a table fan, books in jail; CCTV installed in his cell: Report
140.article_body: Former West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee has been lodged in cell number two of the Presidency Correctional Institution. Reports said that Partha has been given table fan, books and a blanket in his cell. A CCTV was also installed in the cell on Sunday, reports added. His clothes which were with the Enforcement Directorate were given to jail authorities.

141.title: IMD issues red alert for 7 districts in Maharashtra for Tuesday
141.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a 'red alert' for Palghar, Raigad, Nashik, Pune, Gondia, Gadchiroli and Chandrapur districts for Tuesday. It predicted moderate to heavy rainfall in Mumbai city and its suburbs. Intense to very intense spells of rain with gusty winds are very likely to occur at isolated places in the districts of Mumbai, Thane and Palghar, IMD added.

142.title: 'Delhi Crime' is reflection of our passion for storytelling: Shefali
142.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has said that her character DCP Vartika Chaturvedi in the series 'Delhi Crime' will always be "super special" to her. Speaking about the new season of the series, Shefali stated, "I can proudly say this, 'Delhi Crime' is a reflection of our passion for storytelling and the craft...we can't wait for the audience to watch it."

143.title: Will place CWG 2022 gold between those Olympic medals: PV Sindhu
143.article_body: Shuttler PV Sindhu, who won her maiden Commonwealth Games gold in the 2022 Birmingham Games, has said she'll place this medal in the middle of her Olympic medals. "This medal is important to me because this is a big one and this event comes once every four years," she added. Sindhu has a silver and a bronze medal in Olympics.

144.title: RJD MLAs reach Lalu Yadav’s house amid reports of split between JD(U), BJP
144.article_body: RJD MLAs and leaders on Tuesday arrived at party chief Lalu Prasad Yadav's residence in Patna. The party is scheduled to hold a meeting at 11 am today, amid speculations of a 'split' between JD(U) and BJP. The mobile phones of all MLAs were being kept outside the meeting room. MLAs of Left parties also arrived at Yadav's residence.

145.title: HDFC hikes lending rate by 25 bps, home loans to be costlier
145.article_body: Mortgage lender HDFC Limited on Monday announced an increase in its benchmark lending rate by 25 basis points or 0.25% with effect from August 9, 2022. This will make home loans costlier for both existing and new borrowers. This comes after the Reserve Bank of India raised the repo rate by 50 basis points or 0.50% to 5.40% last week.

146.title: Raj CM writes to PM seeking national monument status for Mangarh Dham
146.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has written to PM Narendra Modi seeking national monument status for Mangarh Dham in Banswara district. Gehlot highlighted that in 1913, the British Army opened fire on tribals who had gathered in Mangarh under the leadership of Govind Guru. Thus, conferring a national monument status would be a tribute to great saint Govind Guru, Gehlot added.

147.title: Royal Enfield launches Hunter 350 starting ₹1.49 lakh*
147.article_body: Royal Enfield has launched the new Hunter 350 motorcycle equipped with 350cc J-engine, 17'' manoeuvrable front and rear tyres, cast alloy wheels, digital LCD screen and Royal Enfield Tripper Navigation System. It features a 800mm high seat along with a dual-channel ABS and USB charging port. Customers can choose between Metro Hunters and Retro Hunters variants, starting at ₹1,49,900*.

148.title: Congratulations Arshad bhai: Neeraj Chopra after Pak javelin thrower wins gold at CWG
148.article_body: Olympic gold-medalist Neeraj Chopra congratulated Pakistani javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem after he set a Commonwealth Games record with a throw of 90.18 metres and bagged gold medal. "Congratulations Arshad bhai for gold medal and crossing 90mtr with new games record. Aage ke competitions ke liye all the best," he tweeted. Chopra was ruled out of CWG 2022 due to injury.

149.title: Nitish Kumar foiled BJP's 'Eknath Shinde plan' in Bihar: JD(U) leader
149.article_body: A JD(U) leader claimed on condition of anonymity that Nitish Kumar had spotted in time the BJP's 'Eknath Shinde plan' to sabotage his government in Bihar and changed the game. "BJP wanted RCP Singh to stay in JD(U) and work like Eknath Shinde. Lalan Singh's statement about Chirag model was actually Eknath Shinde model in Bihar," the leader said.

150.title: TMC workers vandalise party MLA's home, claim he took cash for TMC posts
150.article_body: TMC workers vandalised party MLA Idris Ali's house in West Bengal's Murshidabad, alleging that he took money to allot posts in the party's organisation. Ali has, however, denied the allegations and said that some local party leaders were trying to place people with "dubious backgrounds" in TMC's organisation. A huge police contingent was deployed in the area following the incident.

151.title: You would've tried but PM didn't answer 1 question in your tenure: TMC MP to Naidu
151.article_body: Talking about outgoing Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu, TMC MP Derek O'Brien said he always urged Opposition and government to talk to each other and resolve issues. "No one is perfect. You would've tried hard to get our honourable PM to perhaps answer one question in your full tenure. That didn't happen," O'Brien added.

152.title: Snap planning to lay off employees after weak quarterly results: Report
152.article_body: Snap is reportedly in the early stages of planning job cuts. As per a report, the job cuts come after the company reported weak quarterly earnings that also sent its stock to a 52-week low. While it last did layoffs in 2018, Snap CEO Evan Spiegel in May said the firm would slow hiring for the rest of the year.

153.title: Salman wanted to star in the film, I declined: Ghai on SRK-starrer Pardes
153.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai said Salman Khan wanted to feature in Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Pardes', adding he "declined" despite being urged due to the big star cast with Salman, Shah Rukh, Madhuri Dixit starring together. Ghai stated he was told 'Pardes' could become a big hit like 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun'. The filmmaker refused because he needed someone who was stylish.

154.title: Now, I'll try for a medal in Olympics: 40-yr-old Sharath after 3 golds at CWG 2022
154.article_body: India's 40-year-old table tennis player Sharath Kamal, who bagged gold medals in men's singles, mixed doubles and men's team event at CWG 2022, has said he'll now try to win a medal at the Olympics. Overall, Sharath now has 13 medals, including seven golds, at the Commonwealth Games but he's yet to win a medal in Olympics.

155.title: Taapsee gets into argument with paparazzi, says 'actor is always at fault'
155.article_body: A video showing actress Taapsee Pannu involved in an argument with the paparazzi has surfaced on social media. The argument apparently started after the photographers told her that she has turned up late at the event. "I have arrived on time...Please talk to me in a respectful manner...You are always right, and actor is always at fault," she said.

156.title: Security increased, 10,000+ police officials to be at Red Fort on I-Day
156.article_body: Security has been increased in the national capital ahead of Independence Day. Police said that "flawless and foolproof" security arrangements have been made for the day. "On the occasion of Independence Day, more than 10,000 police personnel would be deployed in different roles across the Red Fort and the routes leading to the venue," police added.

157.title: 3 girls climb overhead water tank in Jaipur college demanding ATM, gym
157.article_body: Three female students enrolled in the state-run Maharani College in Rajasthan's Jaipur climbed the overhead water tank on Monday. The students were demanding the opening of ATM machines, banks and open-air gym within the college premises before the student union elections. Police said that the girls came down after assurance from college authorities to look into their demands.

158.title: 15-year-old girl injects herself with boyfriend's HIV positive blood in Assam
158.article_body: A 15-year-old girl from Assam's Sualkuchi district allegedly infected herself with the blood of her boyfriend, who is said to HIV positive. The duo reportedly met each other through Facebook three years ago. Police in Hajo arrested the youth and the girl is currently under medical observation, local media reported.

159.title: India reports 12,751 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, 21% less than yesterday
159.article_body: India has reported 12,751 new COVID-19 cases and 42 deaths in the last 24 hours, including 10 reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,31,807, while the daily positivity rate came down to 3.50%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,26,772.

160.title: Ex-BSP MP Umakant Yadav, 6 others get life sentence in 1995 murder case
160.article_body: A court sentenced former Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) MP Umakant Yadav and six others to life imprisonment for the murder of a Government Railway Police (GRP) constable in 1995. It imposed a ₹5 lakh fine on Yadav and ₹20,000 each on others. The convicts had fired at UP's Shahganj GRP lockup to free his driver who was detained by GRP.

161.title: I respect him, it ends there: Sudeepa on relationship with Rajamouli
161.article_body: Discussing his relationship with 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli with whom he worked in 'Baahubali: The Beginning', actor Kichcha Sudeepa said, "I respect him because of his...passion for storytelling...It ends there." "We'll see when he calls," added Sudeepa. Sudeepa wasn't "called" for playing his role in 'Baahubali: The Conclusion'. "I didn't miss being in the second part," the actor had shared.

162.title: Another 'do or die' movement needed against 'dictatorial' govt: Rahul Gandhi
162.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that today, in India another "do or die" movement is needed against the "dictatorial" government and to protect the country. His statement came on the anniversary of launch of the Quit India Movement. "Now the time has come when it is imperative to speak up against injustice," Gandhi wrote in a Facebook post.

163.title: Mumbai Police shares list of routes to avoid for Muharram procession
163.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police issued notification sharing list of roads that will remain closed for vehicular movement in the view of Muharram procession. "On the occasion of Muharram...60 feet road, 90 feet road, Dharavi, Mahim Sion Link Road, Sant Rohidas Marg, Mahim will be closed for vehicular movement between 3 pm to 12 am," the Mumbai Police said.

164.title: It's like they sold us a car, but kept the keys: Binance over WazirX's ownership
164.article_body: Binance's Chief Communications Officer Patrick Hillmann told CNBC-TV18 they have been trying to "claw back ownership" of WazirX for the last two year. "It's like they sold us a car, handed us the title and then kept the keys with them," Hillmann said. The spat over ownership started last week after the ED froze WazirX's bank assets worth ₹64 crore.

165.title: No plan under consideration to set up 8th Pay Commission: Govt
165.article_body: Union Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary informed the Lok Sabha that the government has no proposal under consideration to constitute the 8th Central Pay Commission for the central government employees. At least seven pay commissions have been constituted since 1947. The central government forms a pay commission after every ten years to revise the salaries of government staff.

166.title: Photo shows Trump clogged White House toilet with torn-up pieces of paper
166.article_body: A photo proving that former US President Donald Trump clogged White House toilet with torn-up pieces of paper has been shared by NYT reporter Maggie Haberman. Trump had denied claims he would flush official documents during his tenure. Haberman also shared another picture, saying it is from an overseas trip that was provided by a Trump White House source.

167.title: Never stood in line to audition, doesn't mean I had no hardships: Janhvi
167.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor stated in an interview that she comes from privilege but had to go through "extremely unrelatable hardships but hardships nonetheless". The actress said, "Just because my struggles in life have not been to put food on the table or to stand in line to audition for a film doesn't mean I haven't dealt with hardships."

168.title: Case against Hyderabad blood bank after 3-yr-old tests HIV positive
168.article_body: A case was filed against a blood bank in Hyderabad after its alleged negligence resulted in a three-year-old thalassaemia patient testing positive for HIV. The child had been undergoing blood transfusions for past 2.5 years at Red Cross blood bank in Adikmet. He tested HIV positive when doctor suggested a blood test following his blood transfusion on July 20.

169.title: B'luru received over 400% excess rains in 1st week of August: Report
169.article_body: Bengaluru received 143 mm of rain between August 1 to 8, as against the normal of 28 mm, indicating a departure of 410%, Hindustan Times reported. However, according to BBMP chief Tushar Giri Nath, the number of people affected this year was "much less". "Flooding...happened in low lying areas and not in habitation areas," Giri Nath added.

170.title: Aamir is enough to bring openings, hope I can add to it in small way: Naga
170.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, predicting about the box office opening of his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said, "Aamir sir is enough to bring those openings." "People love him all over the world in fact, but yes, I hope I can add some advantage to it in some small way," Naga added. The film also features Kareena Kapoor Khan.

171.title: Telangana BJP leader Gnanendra Prasad found hanging at his residence
171.article_body: A Telangana BJP leader, Gnanendra Prasad, was found hanging from a fan at his residence in Miyapur on Monday, officials said. “The reason for his suicide is not known...he was staying in his penthouse for the past few days,” police said. This comes after the Miyapur Police received information that a person died by suicide within the police station limits.

172.title: Stop mocking Parliament: Derek O'Brien as Monsoon Session ends before schedule
172.article_body: TMC leader Derek O'Brien criticised the central government over its decision to end Parliament's Monsoon Session ahead of its schedule and said, "Stop mocking Parliament." "This is the seventh consecutive time Parliament session has been cut short...We will prevent PM Narendra Modi and Amit Shah from turning this great institution into the Gujarat Gymkhana," O'Brien said in a tweet.

173.title: Hirani wasn't happy with Dunki pics leak, can't control crowd with SRK: Taapsee
173.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said actor Shah Rukh Khan and filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani were not happy when pictures from 'Dunki' sets were leaked. "Raju sir's idea is, 'I want to first finish my film and then reveal details'...Shah Rukh sir was in total favour of doing it the same way...[But] with Shah Rukh Khan, you can't control the crowd," she added.

174.title: Part of road caves in following heavy rains in Gurugram; 6 injured
174.article_body: About six people were injured after a part of a road in Gurugram between Sohna Road and Sector 38 (via Islampur) caved in following heavy rains. The cave-in, due to which several vehicles were damaged, occurred on Sunday. Residents have claimed that authorities are yet to fix road despite repeated complaints and that over 10 accidents are reported every day.
