175.title: Truck hits bus, car on Pune-Mumbai expressway; 1 dead, 3 injured
175.article_body: One person was killed and three others suffered minor injuries after a truck collided with a bus and a car on the Pune-Mumbai expressway near Khopoli on Monday. The deceased has been identified as the truck driver. The police suspect that the accident, which occurred at 10.30 am, allegedly took place due to the failed brakes of the truck.

176.title: 2-wheeler skids as Maha woman tries to avoid potholes, dad crushed by truck
176.article_body: A 65-year-old man, Ashok Gurunath Kabadi, was killed after being crushed by a truck, while his daughter, Aditi Gurunath Kabadi, was injured in Bhiwandi on Sunday. The incident took place after their two-wheeler skidded when the daughter who was driving, tried to avoid potholes on the road. The two were on their way to get a Ganesha idol home.

177.title: Decided to end life by jumping off 3rd floor: Vicky's father on battling cancer in 2003
177.article_body: Speaking about his cancer diagnosis in 2003, Sham Kaushal, actor Vicky Kaushal's father and stunt director, said, "I thought there's no chance of me surviving. I had even decided that I'd end my life by jumping off the third floor." He said he was hospitalised for 50 days and later tested every year, but his cancer didn't spread.

178.title: My dear this is also Louis Vuitton: Mahua to journalist who questioned her fashion sense
178.article_body: After a journalist shared TMC MP Mahua Moitra's video, writing, "MP Mahua changes her fashion sense after handbag row or...", she replied, "My dear - this is also Louis Vuitton - the Pochette." She added, "The car's a G-Wagon with an AP numberplate belonging to Andhra MP who we often car pool with. Saved you some detective work here too!"

179.title: If unicorns don't accept lower valuations, startup winter may last longer: Son
179.article_body: SoftBank Group's CEO Masayoshi Son said that startup winter may last longer for unlisted companies than the listed ones, if founders of unicorn companies "still believe in their valuations" and refuse to accept a lower valuation. Son added, "Until the multiple of listed companies is lower than those of unlisted companies, we should wait."

180.title: Thought I'll speak to Rajinikanth for 5 mins, we spoke for 4 hours: Aamir
180.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said he's always been a "big fan" of actor Rajinikanth, adding he starts smiling when the actor comes on screen. "I was supposed to say hello to him for five minutes and leave. Somehow...[we chatted] for four hours...I was very curious to know about the early days of his career. He was telling me everything," added Aamir.

181.title: Thane's Modak Sagar lake overflows for second time
181.article_body: The Modak Sagar lake located in Thane district is overflowing for the second time this year as heavy rainfall increased 3,823 million litres (ML) water in this lake in the past 24 hours. The lake has a useful content of 1,28,925 ML and it supplies 450 ML water to the city per day. It first started overflowing on July 13.

182.title: Family drives into canal in Kerala after following Google Maps for directions
182.article_body: A family of four members was rescued after their car fell into a canal near Kottayam in Kerala. The driver had been following directions from Google Maps which led their vehicle straight into the water. While the car was caught in the currents of the stream and drifted downwards, the passengers were rescued with the help of the local residents.

183.title: 11 organisations from Pune city move Bombay HC over water crisis
183.article_body: As many as 11 organisations from Pune city have moved the Bombay High Court over the water crisis. They have filed public interest litigation seeking directions to authorities to immediately supply 135 litres per day to each citizen. "Urban areas in Pune district are now in the strong grip of the water tanker mafia," the petition claimed.

184.title: 22-year-old MBA aspirant's throat slit by manjha in Delhi, rescued
184.article_body: A 22-year-old MBA aspirant was rescued by a 22-year-old man after his throat was slit by 'manjha' in Delhi, police said. The victim was on his way to Jagatpuri on his motorcycle when the 'manjha' got entangled around his neck. The rescuer, who works for an e-commerce site, took the victim to a hospital within 10 minutes, police added.

185.title: GHMC to build cycle tracks to encourage bicycle use in Hyderabad
185.article_body: To promote use of bicycles in Hyderabad, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to construct bike tracks wherever it's practical. The tracks will be bordered by kerbs on either side to separate cyclists from conventional traffic, ensuring their safety. At present, cycling lanes are being built from Tolichowki to Shaikpet, Narsapur Road to Balanagar and Mettuguda to Tarnaka.

186.title: My daily dose of entertainment: Shehnaaz on rumours of quitting 'Kabhi...'
186.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill took to Instagram and refuted the rumours that suggested she had quit Salman Khan-starrer 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. "LOL! These rumours are my daily dose of entertainment for the last few weeks. I can't wait for people to watch the movie and of course me too in the movie," Shehnaaz wrote. The film also features Pooja Hegde.

187.title: No one knew my name after hit film, called me 'Monologue wala ladka': Kartik
187.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that there were times when he did not get "proper results" even when his movies were hit. "People could not recognise me...and did not know my name," he said, adding, "They used to call me 'monologue wala ladka or guy'. They did not know my name for around 6-7 years, when I was already doing films."

188.title: 1st 8-car metro train ready for technical trials, coaches arrive in Mumbai
188.article_body: The first eight-car prototype metro train made by the Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation (MMRC) is now ready for technical trials. Reports said that the first four metro coaches arrived in Mumbai last week, while the last four arrived on Monday. The train has been made by battery-operated rail cum road shunter that was procured for MMRC metro car depot.

189.title: Donald Trump's Florida home raided by FBI
189.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump said FBI agents raided his Mar-a-Lago estate on Monday. The raid was part of an investigation into Trump's removal of official presidential records from the White House to his Florida resort. Trump said that FBI broke into his safe, adding, "This unannounced raid on my home was not necessary or appropriate."

190.title: It's bad Sidhu Moosewala's unreleased tracks were leaked: Gippy Grewal
190.article_body: Punjabi actor-singer Gippy Grewal, speaking about late singer Sidhu Moosewala, has said, "When I visited his father, he said that there are almost 40-50 songs which are yet to be released." He further stated that he does not know how people leaked songs and added that it is "very bad". Sidhu was shot dead in May this year.

191.title: Google Search down for thousands of users worldwide, showing 'Error 500'
191.article_body: Google Search is down for thousands of users across the globe on Tuesday morning, according to outage tracking website Downdetector. Several users took to Twitter to share that they are being shown an 'Error 500 (Server Error)' message while using Google Search. "The server encountered an error and could not complete your request," the message further says.

192.title: West Bengal records 377 fresh COVID-19 cases, 5 deaths
192.article_body: West Bengal reported 377 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Monday with a daily positivity rate of 5.73%, a health department bulletin said. The state also recorded five fatalities due to the infection, the bulletin added. As a result, the state's COVID-19 death toll rose to 21,400. West Bengal's active case count reached 7,302 with Monday's new cases.

193.title: Manoj Prabhakar appointed as head coach of Nepal cricket team
193.article_body: Former India all-rounder Manoj Prabhakar has been named as the head coach of the Nepal national cricket team. "Seeing the interest for cricket in Nepal...I'm really looking forward...to make them into a cricketing force to be reckoned with," Prabhakar said. Notably, the 59-year-old former cricketer played 39 Tests and 130 ODIs for India between 1984 and 1996.

194.title: They become overexcited: Maqsood on Pakistan losing to India in WC
194.article_body: Pakistani batter Sohaib Maqsood talked about Pakistan's poor record against India in World Cup matches. "The reason for...consistent defeat against India in World Cup matches is because the Pakistani [players become] overexcited," he said. The 35-year-old batter added, "However, in the recent past, our team has started treating Indo-Pak matches normally, and it has improved our performance too."

195.title: Man, wife swept away in overflowing drain in Maharashtra
195.article_body: A farmer and his wife were swept away in an overflowing major drain in Maharashtra's Yavatmal district. The deceased, identified as Subhash Raut (55) and Sulochna (50), were staying on their farm for the past two to three days to protect the crops from animals, an official said. The incident happened while the couple was returning from the farm.

196.title: Third tank at Cuban fuel storage facility catches fire, collapses
196.article_body: A third fuel storage tank went ablaze and collapsed after flames spread from another oil tank that caught fire two days earlier at Cuba's main oil terminal in Matanzas, governor of Matanzas province said. A series of oil tank fires was triggered when lightning struck one of the tanks at the fuel storage facility last Friday.

197.title: What's the Electricity Amendment Bill & why are power engineers protesting it?
197.article_body: The government on Monday introduced the Electricity Amendment Bill in the Lok Sabha. The legislation will allow private companies to supply electricity provided they get a license. It will also let private companies use power distribution networks built by public sector firms. Power engineers in many states are protesting it, saying it will result in losses for government discoms.

198.title: Slap scene in 'Kabir Singh' was blown out of proportion: Kiara Advani
198.article_body: Kiara Advani has said the scene where her character Preeti is slapped by Shahid Kapoor's Kabir in 'Kabir Singh' was 'blown out of proportion'. "Preeti leaves Kabir...You don't see that, you forget...that," Kiara said, adding, "When you take a scene out...and blow it out of proportion then you just talk about the scene, you've not seen the film in totality."

199.title: Iran's negotiators for nuclear deal to return from Vienna: Report
199.article_body: Iran's delegation of negotiators will return to Tehran from Vienna after days of indirect talks with the US for revival of the 2015 nuclear deal, Iranian state media reported on Monday. Consultations would reportedly continue with coordinators of the negotiations and other parties of the pact. Indirect talks between Iran and the US to salvage the deal resumed last Thursday.

200.title: India's golden girl hence proved her name once again: Raina on Sindhu's CWG gold
200.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina congratulated shuttler PV Sindhu for winning the women's singles gold medal at CWG 2022 and wrote, "India's golden girl Sindhu hence proved her name once again by achieving her first-ever gold medal [in women's singles] at...CWG 2022." He added, "Keep shining." Sindhu had won bronze at CWG 2014 and silver at CWG 2018 in women's singles.

201.title: Australian swimmer Emma McKeon won more medals than 56 countries at CWG 2022
201.article_body: Australia's 28-year-old swimmer Emma McKeon bagged more medals than 56 nations/territories at CWG 2022. She bagged one bronze, one silver and six gold medals across various swimming events at the Games. Out of the 72 countries/territories that took part in CWG 2022, only 16 won eight or more medals.

202.title: Which Indians won more than one medal at CWG 2022?
202.article_body: Ten Indian athletes bagged more than one medal at CWG 2022. Table tennis player Sharath Kamal bagged a total of four medals, including three gold and one silver. Sathiyan Gnanasekaran bagged a gold, silver and bronze across table tennis events. Further, seven shuttlers, including PV Sindhu and Lakshya Sen, bagged two medals each. Squash player Saurav Ghosal won two bronze.

203.title: Doing a Rajamouli film is equivalent to taking up 25 films at once: Mahesh
203.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu, while speaking about his upcoming film with SS Rajamouli, said, "It's going to be physically demanding." "Doing one film with Rajamouli garu is like taking up 25 films at once," he added. "It's going to be a pan-India film. I hope we break many barriers and take our work to audiences across the country," Mahesh further said.

204.title: 3 people, including a minor, killed as bus overturns in Rajasthan
204.article_body: Three people, including a minor, were killed and 11 got injured after a speeding private bus overturned on the Udaipur-Gujarat national highway in Rajasthan's Dungarpur district. Two of the three deceased were identified as Kalyan Singh (28) and Nidhi Jatav (10), police said. Notably, the injured are undergoing treatment at a local hospital, police added.

205.title: 6,195 km of border roads are under construction: Government
205.article_body: Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt said that 6,195 km of India's border roads are currently under construction. Replying to a Rajya Sabha question, Bhatt said that the Border Roads Organisation constructs roads on the basis of strategic requirements of a region and priorities fixed by the Indian Army. These roads are beneficial in troops' quick mobilisation, he added.

206.title: Asked SRK to avoid his romantic side in Pardes, was challenging for him: Ghai
206.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai, while recalling working with Shah Rukh Khan in the 1997 film 'Pardes', said, "I kept reminding him in every scene and song that he has to avoid his compelling, romantic side to justify Arjun's character." He added that it was challenging for him but he nailed it. 'Pardes' completed 25 years of its release on Monday.

207.title: Happy birthday to my favourite sportsperson of all time: Pankaj to Federer
207.article_body: Twenty-four time world champion cueist Pankaj Advani took to Twitter to wish 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer on his 41st birthday on Monday and wrote, "Happy birthday to my favourite sportsperson of all time." Former world number one Federer has not played on the ATP Tour since his quarter-final loss at Wimbledon 2021.

208.title: US-China ties are worsening, a storm is gathering: Singapore PM
208.article_body: Singapore PM Lee Hsien Loong on Monday warned of the scope for miscalculations in US-China ties over tensions in the Taiwan Strait. "Around us, a storm is gathering. US-China relations are worsening, with intractable issues, deep suspicions and limited engagement," PM Lee added. China announced fresh military drills in the seas and airspace around Taiwan earlier today.

209.title: Varun shares pic of namkeen packet featuring his look from 'Bawaal'
209.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to his Instagram Stories to share a picture of a namkeen packet which was inspired from his upcoming film 'Bawaal'. The wrapper had a picture of Varun's look from the film. "This is crazy," he wrote. The film, directed by Nitesh Tiwari and backed by Sajid Nadiadwala's banner Nadiadwala Grandson Entertainment, will also star Janhvi Kapoor.

210.title: It'd be 'open season' if Russia were allowed to bully Ukraine: US
210.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Monday said that if Russia were allowed to bully Ukraine and take over its territory unopposed, then it would be "open season" around the world. The US felt the need to stand up to Russia as its hostility against Ukraine threatened the foundational principles of the international system, Blinken added.

211.title: Congratulations to Sharath, Sathiyan, Indian men's hockey team at CWG: Sachin
211.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar congratulated Indian table tennis players Sharath Kamal for winning the gold medal and Sathiyan Gnanasekaran for bagging bronze in men's singles at CWG 2022. He also congratulated Indian men's hockey team for winning silver. "As our CWG 2022 campaign ends, I'd like to appreciate our athletes who participated, and best wishes for all their future endeavours," tweeted Tendulkar.

212.title: Appeasement caused a gap between many sections of society: Shah
212.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said that "a gap started to arise between many sections of society" due to "appeasement". "Because of nepotism, no matter how much capacity someone had, he never got a chance," Shah said at an event in Bhubaneswar. He added, "Due to corruption, the economy of the society and the campaigns for social welfare were becoming hollow."

213.title: UGC-NET phase 2 exam postponed, will be held between September 20-30
213.article_body: The second phase of the UGC-NET examination has been postponed and will now be conducted between September 20 and 30, UGC Chairman M Jagadesh Kumar said. Earlier, it was scheduled to be held between August 12 and 14. The admit cards will be issued on September 16 and the city of the examination centre will be displayed on September 11.

214.title: Israel reopens Gaza border after Egypt-brokered truce amid conflict
214.article_body: Israel reopened border crossings into Gaza on Monday after an Egypt-brokered truce with Islamic Jihad group ended intense fighting which commenced on August 5. Over 40 people were killed in 56 hours of violence that began when Israeli airstrikes hit a senior Islamic Jihad commander. "There's no doubt Islamic Jihad was dealt a serious blow," an Israeli military official said.

215.title: Goddess Parvati idol worth ₹1.7 cr that was stolen from TN found in US
215.article_body: An idol of Goddess Parvati that was allegedly stolen from a temple in Tamil Nadu in 1971, has been traced to an auction house in New York, authorities said. The 12th-century copper alloy idol is worth $212,575 (around ₹1.69 crore) and measures about 52 cm in height. It dates back to the Chola period, authorities said.

216.title: Body of Gujarat man who was seen in crocodile attack video recovered
216.article_body: Gujarat forest department has recovered the body of a 30-year-old man who was seen getting attacked by a crocodile in several videos that surfaced online on Sunday. The NDRF began a search operation shortly after the videos of the man being pulled into the Dhadhar river by the crocodile, near Sokhdaraghu village in Vadodara, started circulating on social media.

217.title: Inspiring, encouraging & rewarding: PM on outgoing Vice Prez Naidu
217.article_body: PM Narendra Modi bid farewell to Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Monday and called his term "inspiring, encouraging, rewarding" for future generations. "Venkaiah ji's life is a huge legacy for us. Whatever we have learned with him, let us carry on," PM Modi said. "We should ensure that his advice is always utilised," PM Modi added.

218.title: Railway official saves woman, son who slipped while boarding train; video viral
218.article_body: A female Railway Protection Force officer saved an elderly woman and her son at West Bengal's Bankura station after they slipped while boarding a moving train. Sharing a video of the incident on social media, Railways Ministry wrote, "Service and Seva Bhav." "Passengers are requested not to board or alight a moving train," the Ministry further wrote.

219.title: I'll be missing you all: Outgoing Vice President to Rajya Sabha MPs
219.article_body: Outgoing Vice President Venkaiah Naidu in his farewell speech in Rajya Sabha said, "I am very happy on one side and on the other side I feel I'll be missing you all as I'll not be in this position of chairing the House from August 10 onwards." He added that he always used to say 'Namaste' while greeting the House.

220.title: India considering banning Chinese firms from selling smartphones under ₹12,000: Reports
220.article_body: The Indian government is reportedly considering banning Chinese smartphone makers from selling devices cheaper than ₹12,000. The move is reportedly aimed at giving a boost to homegrown brands. As per a report, smartphones under ₹12,000 contributed to a third of India's sales volume for this financial year's second quarter, with Chinese firms accounting for around 80% of those shipments.

221.title: Ruling to end constitutional abortion right in US is shocking: Felix
221.article_body: Eleven-time Olympic medallist Allyson Felix has said that the US Supreme Court's judgement to end the constitutional right to an abortion is "shocking". "We're trying to move forward and not take steps back," Felix said. The US sprinter added, "I want my daughter to grow up in a world where there is a true sense of equality."

222.title: Proud of the Indian men's hockey team for winning CWG 2022 silver: PM Modi
222.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said he's proud of the Indian men's hockey team for a "spirited performance" through the CWG 2022 and winning the silver medal. He added, "I'm confident this team will keep making India proud in the times to come and also inspire youngsters to pursue hockey." India lost 0-7 to Australia in the final on Monday.

223.title: 174 dengue cases reported in Delhi so far this year
223.article_body: A report released by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) on Monday said that Delhi reported 174 cases of dengue this year till August 6. No deaths due to the infection have been recorded in the national capital so far this year, the report added. Last year, Delhi had logged 9,613 cases of dengue.

224.title: India announce squad for Asia Cup, Virat Kohli returns
224.article_body: Team India squad for the upcoming Asia Cup has been announced. Virat Kohli, who was rested for West Indies limited-over series, has been included. KL Rahul, who underwent groin surgery in June and recently recovered from COVID-19, has also been included. Fast bowlers Jasprit Bumrah and Harshal Patel weren't available for selection owing to injuries, the BCCI said.

225.title: Had an ugly fight with Taapsee on 'Manmarziyaan' set: Anurag Kashyap
225.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap in an interview revealed that he and actress Taapsee Pannu fight a lot during shoots. He recalled how the two of them had an ugly fight during the shoot of 'Manmarziyaan'. "She left and I thought now this is over but later she came back as if nothing happened," Anurag added. 'Manmarziyaan' was released in 2018.

226.title: Indian Oil unit to open 50 fuel stations in SL to help alleviate fuel crisis
226.article_body: Sri Lanka has given approval for Lanka Indian Oil Corporation (LIOC) to open 50 new fuel stations to help reduce severe fuel shortages in Sri Lanka. LIOC already has 216 fuel stations in Sri Lanka and will invest about ₹200 crore on the expansion. We're more than willing to support and work with Sri Lanka, said LIOC MD Manoj Gupta.

227.title: 'Infiltration' of Bangladeshi Muslims big problem in J'khand: BJP MP
227.article_body: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey on Monday raised in Lok Sabha the issue of "infiltration" of Bangladeshi Muslims in Jharkhand, demanding that the government carry out the National Population Register exercise in the state. "There is Islamization with students being taught in Urdu in government schools and the weekly holiday now shifted to Friday," he said.

228.title: Leaders like Sibal criticise courts after unfavourable rulings: Rijiju
228.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Monday slammed Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal for his criticism of the Supreme Court, saying that Opposition leaders attack constitutional authorities when their judgments do not favour them. Sibal on Saturday criticised the SC, saying that sensitive cases are being assigned to selective judges, adding that he has no hope left in the institution.

229.title: Hoping to meet PM Modi soon: Sindhu after winning 1st-ever CWG singles gold
229.article_body: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu said she's hoping to meet PM Narendra Modi soon after clinching her first-ever gold medal in women's singles at Commonwealth Games. "I'd like to thank PM Modi for his words," she added. Earlier, PM Modi congratulated Sindhu and said, "The phenomenal Sindhu is a champion of champions! She repeatedly shows what excellence is all about."

230.title: Should've won awards for Dhamaal, my role wasn't as easy as it looked: Jaaved
230.article_body: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi has said he deserved awards for his performance in the 2007 comedy 'Dhamaal'. "I didn't get any award for 'Dhamaal'," he said, adding that his role wasn't as easy as it looked. The film was directed by Indra Kumar. It also featured Sanjay Dutt, Riteish Deshmukh, Arshad Warsi and Ashish Chowdhry, among others in pivotal roles.

231.title: How does India's medal tally at CWG 2022 compare to other editions?
231.article_body: India won 22 gold medals and a total of 61 medals at CWG 2022. India equalled the gold medal tally they had registered at CWG 2006, marking their joint-fourth best CWG performance. India had bagged 38 gold medals at CWG 2010, 30 at CWG 2002 and 26 at CWG 2018. India's overall CWG 2022 medal tally is their fifth best.

232.title: It was tough for him to sit still, he called all party workers in lockdown: PM on Naidu
232.article_body: Talking about outgoing Vice-President Venkaiah Naidu, PM Narendra Modi said he thought the COVID-19 lockdown would be a "big punishment" for Naidu. "It was very difficult for him (Naidu) to sit still...but he made use of time," said PM Modi. Naidu called nearly every party worker during the lockdown, asked about their well-being and provided help if needed, PM said.

233.title: No talks if Russia holds referendums in captured regions: Ukraine Prez
233.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday stated that if Russia proceeds with conducting referendums in the occupied regions of his country over joining Russia, there could be no talks with Ukraine or its international allies. He added that Ukraine won't yield any territory to Russia. Russia exercises control over several territories in Ukraine's Donbas region and Kherson.

234.title: Didn't put too much pressure on myself: Lakshya after maiden CWG gold win
234.article_body: Following his maiden gold medal at CWG, Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen said he didn't put too much pressure on himself in the men's singles final. "From the very beginning, I was feeling that I can do well," he added. Lakshya lost the opening game before winning the second and third against Malaysia's Ng Tze Yong. Lakshya won 19-21, 21-9, 21-16.

235.title: Naidu breaks down as O'Brien narrates how the outgoing VP lost his mother, video emerges
235.article_body: Outgoing Vice-President Venkaiah Naidu broke down in the Rajya Sabha on Monday, when TMC MP Derek O'Brien narrated how Naidu lost his mother when he was one year old. O'Brien recounted how one of the bulls owned by Naidu's family in Andhra Pradesh attacked the latter's mother while she had him in his arms. Naidu got teary-eyed during the story.

236.title: Debt-ridden share trader dies by suicide in Surat
236.article_body: A 45-year-old debt-ridden share trader died by suicide in Surat, Gujarat. The deceased, Praveen Kumbhani, was allegedly getting threats from people to whom he owed money, police said. Kumbhani was a resident of Kanteshwar Mahadev society, but ended his life in another apartment in Katargam. The deceased has left a suicide note as well, police added.

237.title: Value ties with Beijing, committed to 'One China' policy: B'desh PM
237.article_body: Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina on Sunday reaffirmed the country's support for 'One China' policy, adding that Dhaka values its friendship with Beijing. The announcement came as China and Bangladesh signed four Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) and agreements following Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi's visit to Dhaka. Yi said China would support issues involving Bangladesh in international forums.

238.title: China and Thailand to hold joint air combat exercise this month
238.article_body: China and Thailand will resume an annual joint air combat exercise later this month that was on hold for two years during the COVID-19 pandemic, the Thai Air Force said. The "Falcon Strike" exercise will be held at a former US air base in Thailand's Udon Thani. The exercise will begin on August 14 and last for 11 days.

239.title: Crypto lender Hodlnaut halts withdrawals 'due to market conditions'
239.article_body: Singapore-based Hodlnaut has halted withdrawals, token swaps and deposits due to recent market conditions, it said on Monday. Hodlnaut has also informed the Monetary Authority of Singapore of its intention to withdraw its application for a license to provide digital token payment services. The firm said it made the move "to [also] focus on stabilising [Hodlnaut's] liquidity and preserving assets".

240.title: Netaji's great-granddaughter Rajshree put under house arrest in UP
240.article_body: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose's great-granddaughter Rajshree Chaudhary Bose was asked to deboard a train and put under house arrest in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj on Sunday. She has been kept at a guest house in the reserve police line. Rajshree was going to Varanasi to attend an event organised by the Vishwa Hindu Sena as the chief guest.

241.title: Jaffer congratulates 40-yr-old Sharath on his 7th CWG gold, calls him an institution
241.article_body: Congratulating India's 40-year-old table tennis player Sharath Kamal on his seventh gold medal at the Commonwealth Games, Wasim Jaffer said, "He's an institution and an inspiration." Sharath defeated England's Liam Pitchford 11-13, 11-7, 11-2, 11-6, 11-8 in the men's singles final to win his seventh gold in Birmingham on Monday. Overall, Sharath has won 13 medals at Commonwealth Games.

242.title: Alia is a big star but doesn't carry the stardom with her: Co-star Vikram
242.article_body: Actor Vikram Pratap, while sharing his experience of working with Alia Bhatt in 'Darlings', said, "It was lovely." He added that Alia is a big star but doesn't carry the stardom with her. "She is humble and down to earth as a person. It was very comfortable working with her," Vikram further said. Vikram made his acting debut with 'Darlings'.

243.title: How does the final CWG 2022 medal tally read?
243.article_body: Australia finished on top of the medal standings at CWG 2022 with 67 gold medals, while England finished second with 57 gold medals. Australia and England were the only two countries at CWG 2022 to bag more than 100 medals. As many as 43 nations/territories won at least one medal each. India finished on fourth position at CWG 2022.

244.title: Days getting longer on Earth despite recent shortest day on record: Experts
244.article_body: The length of Earth's days has been "mysteriously increasing" despite Earth clocking the shortest day ever in June 2022, experts have said. Earth's rotation around its axis (which determines a day's length) sped up over the past few decades, the researchers said. However, there's been a slowdown since 2020, making days longer and the reason is a "mystery", they said.

245.title: Will accept it if my paycheck matches his: Taapsee on 'lady Akshay Kumar' tag
245.article_body: Taapsee Pannu in an interview reacted to being called 'lady Akshay Kumar' for doing a lot of films and said, "I'll accept this compliment...humbly if my paycheck matches his until then please don't do that." In the same interview, Anurag Kashyap said Akshay is the sixth richest actor in the world, to which Taapsee replied, "I'm not even near that."

246.title: SoftBank planning job cuts at Vision Fund after record net loss: CEO
246.article_body: SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son said the firm is planning to cut headcount at its Vision Fund investing arm after the conglomerate reported a record quarterly net loss. Vision Fund reported a $23.1 billion loss in the April-June quarter. It had approved just $600 million in new investments in the first quarter against $20.6 billion in the same quarter last year.

247.title: Ukraine calls for demilitarisation of nuclear plant hit by shelling
247.article_body: Petro Kotin, chief of Ukraine's state-run nuclear power company Energoatom, has called for the deployment of UN peacekeepers at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant following renewed shelling that reportedly hit the plant twice in recent days. "We demand from the world community... to withdraw the invaders(Russian forces) from the territory of the station and create a demilitarised zone," Kotin stated.

248.title: Smashing their way into history books: Anurag on Rankireddy-Shetty's CWG gold
248.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter to congratulate Indian duo of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty following their gold medal in the final of men's doubles badminton event at Commonwealth Games and wrote, "Smashing their way into history books!" Notably, it is India's first-ever gold in badminton men's doubles event in the history of Commonwealth Games.

249.title: No proposal to establish any new IIT in the country: Government
249.article_body: The Union Minister of State for Education Subhas Sarkar has informed that there is no "proposal to establish any new IIT in the country". "Accordingly, new IITs at Tirupati and Palakkad started their academic session in 2015 and IITs at Bhilai, Jammu, Goa and Dharwad started in 2016," Sarkar informed while replying to a written question in Lok Sabha.

250.title: China announces fresh military drills around Taiwan, 'not afraid,' says Taiwan
250.article_body: The Chinese military on Monday announced fresh drills in the seas and airspace around Taiwan, amid heightened tensions over US House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi's recent visit to Taipei. This came a day after the scheduled end of the biggest-ever military exercises held by China near Taiwan. Condemning the move, Taiwan said it 'won't be afraid or back down'.

251.title: Don’t know who is real CM, says Aaditya mocking Shinde-Fadnavis govt
251.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Monday criticised the Eknath Shinde-Devendra Fadnavis government in Maharashtra and said it was difficult to understand who is the real CM of the state. Thackeray said the verdict in Sena's battle in the SC against the rebel MLAs will have an impact not just on the party, but on the entire nation.

252.title: India finish CWG 2022 on 4th position with 22 gold medals
252.article_body: India finished CWG 2022 on the fourth position on the medal standings. India won 22 gold, 16 silver and 23 bronze medals. Out of India's 22 gold medals, six came from wrestling, four from table tennis and para table tennis, three each from weightlifting, badminton and boxing. India also bagged one gold each in lawn bowls, para powerlifting and athletics.

253.title: Kerala CM helped release UAE national caught with satellite phone: Swapna Suresh
253.article_body: The main accused in the Kerala gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, on Monday alleged that CM Pinarayi Vijayan helped a UAE national, who was held with a satellite phone, to escape in 2017. "These illegal activities were done so as to ensure that [CM's] daughter Veena Vijayan was able to start a business venture in the UAE," Suresh said.

254.title: Don't have info on whether Shrikant Tyagi is here: U'khand Police
254.article_body: Uttarakhand Police on Monday said that it doesn't have information to indicate whether politician Shrikant Tyagi is in the state. The statement came after reports suggested that Tyagi, who went missing after assaulting a woman in Noida, turned up in Rishikesh and Haridwar. Noida Police have announced a ₹25,000 cash reward for the person who helps track down Tyagi.

255.title: Execs told to work as baggage handlers by Australian airline amid staff shortage
255.article_body: Australia's national carrier Qantas Airways has asked its executives and managers from the head office to work as full-time baggage handlers for three months, amid a critical shortage of labour. Qantas COO said the airline needs 100 volunteers from its management staff to handle baggage. The shortage had forced the airline to cancel 8.1% of scheduled domestic services in June.

256.title: Electricity Amendment Bill attack on rights of states: Punjab CM Mann
256.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday dubbed the introduction of the Electricity (Amendment) Bill 2022, in Parliament by the Centre an "attack on the constitutional rights of the states". He said that the Centre should not consider the states as puppets and they would not sit silently against this attempt to dilute the federal spirit of India's democracy.

257.title: BEST announces launch of new Ho-Ho AC bus service from CSMT from Aug 8
257.article_body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) has announced the launch of new Hop-on Hop-off (Ho-Ho) AC bus service from August 8 onwards in a bid to boost tourism in Mumbai. The bus will depart everyday between 9:00 am and 8:00 pm from Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT). The fare for the bus service is ₹150/person to travel an entire day.

258.title: News anchor Navika given protection from arrest by SC in Prophet remarks case
258.article_body: News anchor Navika Kumar was on Monday granted interim protection from arrest in the case linked to suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad during a May 26 TV debate. It said that no coercive action will be taken against Navika in connection to the FIRs filed over the debate previously or in future, as an interim measure.

259.title: Western Railway announces special trains to meet Raksha Bandhan rush
259.article_body: To cater to the rush of passengers during Raksha Bandhan, the Western Railway has announced six special trains. According to a press release, the Bandra-Bhavnagar terminus superfast special train (09207) will run on August 13 from the Bandra Terminus at 7:25 pm and reach Bhavnagar at 9:25 am on the next day.

260.title: 150 bikers take rally from Pune to Mumbai under Har Ghar Tiranga campaign
260.article_body: As many as 150 bikers flagged off a rally under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign from Pune to  Gateway of India in Mumbai. The 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign was introduced by PM Narendra Modi last month to mark the 75th anniversary of Independence Day. PM Modi urged people to display the national flag at their homes from August 13 to 15.

261.title: Female bus marshal attempted suicide over harassment by DTC staff: DCW
261.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women Chairperson Swati Maliwal on Monday wrote to DTC over a female bus marshal attempting to commit suicide after being harassed by a DTC bus conductor. The conductor used to force her for sexual favours and took ₹25,000 for her transfer. The depot manager and other staff began harassing her after she complained to depot's higher officials.

262.title: NCB seizes drugs worth ₹5 cr in Mumbai, 3 arrested
262.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau has seized large quantities of different drugs, collectively worth ₹5 crore, in three operations in Mumbai and Raigad and arrested three persons, an official said on Monday. Acting on a tip-off, the NCB's Mumbai zonal unit seized 870 grams of hydroponic weed last Tuesday in a courier parcel from a Foreign Post Office.

263.title: Jason Roy is England's best player, a World Cup winner: Pietersen
263.article_body: Amid English batter Jason Roy's lean patch in T20Is, former cricketer Kevin Pietersen has said that Roy is "England's best player". "Jason is 32...and what I'm sick and tired of in this country is writing people off at such a young age. Jason is a World Cup winner; he's done an unbelievable job for Eoin Morgan," Pietersen said.

264.title: Chhattisgarh school principal arrested for molesting 2 girl students
264.article_body: Police have arrested the 45-year-old principal of a private school in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur district for allegedly molesting two minor girl students, an official said on Monday. The students, who study in classes 5 and 7, informed their parents after reaching home last week that the principal allegedly molested them in his office chamber, Kotwali SHO Prakash Rathore said.

265.title: India lose 0-7 to Australia in men's hockey gold medal match, bag their 3rd silver at CWG
265.article_body: The Indian men's hockey team settled for silver medal after losing the gold medal match 0-7 against Australia at CWG 2022. It is the third time that India have bagged a silver medal in men's hockey at CWG. Further, Australia have now won men's hockey gold medal at CWG for the seventh straight time.

266.title: B'luru metro increases frequency of early morning & late night trains
266.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited on Monday increased the frequency of trains running during the early morning and late night hours. The metro trains will run at intervals of 15 minutes between 5 am and 6 am and 10 pm and 11 pm. The metro trains in the city used to operate after every 20 minutes.

267.title: Ali and I will get married this year, we're very excited: Richa Chadha
267.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha in an interview said that she'll get married to her actor-boyfriend Ali Fazal this year. "We're very excited to get married but [we're] just worried about COVID and want to be responsible," she added. According to reports, the couple will tie the knot in September and will host a reception in Mumbai with 350-400 guests in attendance.

268.title: What a fighter: Jaffer on 20-year-old Lakshya's maiden gold at CWG
268.article_body: Reacting to 20-year-old Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen winning his maiden gold medal at the Commonwealth Games, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "What a fighter! Just refused to give up until he won. Which he did. Through sheer will. Congratulations Lakshya." Lakshya beat Ng Tze Yong of Malaysia 19-21, 21-9, 21-16 in the final of men's singles event on Monday.

269.title: Ambulance stopped in TN's Thanjavur to let minister's convoy pass
269.article_body: An ambulance was stopped in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur on Monday to give passage to state Education Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi's convoy. There were around 20-25 cars in the convoy of the minister, who was reportedly going to a location to review the flood prevention work. A video of the incident also surfaced on social media.

270.title: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal wins his 7th gold medal at CWG
270.article_body: India's 40-year-old table tennis player Sharath Kamal today bagged his seventh gold medal at CWG. Sharath defeated England's Liam Pitchford to win the men's singles gold at CWG 2022. He has won two men's singles gold (2006 and 2022), three men's team gold (2006, 2018 and 2022), one men's doubles gold (2010) and a mixed doubles gold (2022) at CWG.

271.title: It's a free country, people can do whatever they want: Akshay on boycott calls
271.article_body: Akshay Kumar, when asked about the social media trends demanding a boycott on 'Raksha Bandhan' and 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said, "It's a free country, everybody is allowed to do whatever they want." However, he added every industry, including the film industry, helps the Indian economy. "I'd...request to not get into it as it'll be better for our country," said Akshay.

272.title: Credit to Rohit, Dravid for giving clarity on my role: Arshdeep
272.article_body: Indian pacer Arshdeep Singh has said that credit should be given to skipper Rohit Sharma and coach Rahul Dravid for giving him clarity on his role in the team. "We have to do whatever the demand of the wicket and the team is...As Dravid sir says we are a process-based team so I stick with my process," Arshdeep said.

273.title: Centre should provide free education, unemployment allowance: Kejriwal
273.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday demanded that the Centre provide quality free education, healthcare, 300 units of electricity and unemployment allowance in the country. He said, "There are some people who call the provision of free education, free treatment by government facilities as 'rewadi' or 'freebies'." Kejriwal added that those who oppose such things should be called traitors.

274.title: London Police strip-searched 650 kids in 2 years, several Black: Data
274.article_body: London Police strip-searched 650 children over a two-year period, new data by the police force has shown. More than 95% of those who were strip-searched were boys and 58% of them were Black by race, the data stated. Reacting to the data, England’s commissioner for children, Rachel de Souza, said she was "extremely concerned" at the ethnic imbalance.

275.title: India win badminton men's doubles gold medal for the first time in CWG history
275.article_body: India on Monday created history by winning gold in the badminton men's doubles event for the first time at CWG. The Indian duo of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty defeated the English pair of Ben Lane and Sean Vendy. It's India's third badminton gold at CWG 2022 after PV Sindhu and Lakshya Sen's gold medals in their respective singles categories.

276.title: Tree planted by Sena leader Bal Thackeray falls due to heavy rains in Mumbai
276.article_body: A Gulmohar tree planted by Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray at Shivaji Park ground in Mumbai fell because of heavy rains on Monday, a civic official said. A memorial was built near the tree following Thackeray's death in 2012. The tree fell on the opposite side of the memorial, the official added.

277.title: 22 tourists stuck near waterfall in Nashik rescued, one missing
277.article_body: As many as 22 tourists who were stuck near a waterfall in Nashik due to heavy rains were rescued, while one person was feared to have been swept away, police said. They went to see the Dugarwadi waterfall on Sunday evening. The water level rose and the visitors could not return from there due to the darkness.

278.title: Chile's mysterious sinkhole doubles in size, can engulf Statue of Unity; pic surfaces
278.article_body: A sinkhole which opened up mysteriously a few days ago in Chile has doubled in size, growing large enough to engulf the world's tallest statue, the Statue of Unity at 182 metres in Gujarat. The sinkhole now goes down 200 metres and stretches across 50 metres. The National Service of Geology and Mining said it is still investigating the sinkhole.

279.title: 5G services will roll out in a month, 6G stack development in progress: Minister
279.article_body: Minister of State for Telecom Devusinh Chauhan on Monday said 5G services will be rolled out in about a month and the 6G Technology Innovations Group is working towards the development of indigenous 6G stack. India is likely to deploy indigenously developed and manufactured 5G telecom gears by end-2022, he said. "We've developed fully indigenous 5G test bed," he added.

280.title: Residents of Belathur in B'luru stage protest against BBMP
280.article_body: The residents of Bengaluru's Belathur on Sunday staged a protest against the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) after the locality witnessed waterlogging due to recent rains. They also alleged that the locality lacks basic amenities like decent roads and footpaths. A video showing residents standing on both sides of a road and protesting against the BBMP surfaced online.

281.title: Over 10,000 police officials to be on duty in Delhi on 76th I-Day
281.article_body: Over 10,000 police officials will be on duty in Delhi on India's 76th Independence Day to "ensure fail-proof security arrangements", Dependra Pathak, Special CP (Law and Order) for Delhi, said. Pathak added that drill simulations, tenant verification and other measures are being undertaken. The Intelligence Bureau has also advised Delhi Police to be on high alert amid perceived terror threats.

282.title: Woman held while on way to dispose live-in partner's body in Ghaziabad
282.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was arrested in Ghaziabad while attempting to dispose off the body of her live-in partner, which she had stuffed inside a trolley bag. Abijith R Shankar, ASP (Kavinagar) said that the accused had been pressurizing the deceased to marry her after having lived together for four years. She slashed his throat with a razor when he refused.

283.title: Man attacked, thrown off train in UP for spitting pan masala
283.article_body: Railway pantry staff allegedly attacked a man and threw him out of a moving train in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur district for spitting pan masala, police said on Monday. The victim's sister got off the train at Lalitpur station, but the pantry staff did not allow the victim to leave. He was later beaten up and thrown off the moving train.

284.title: Was in tears when PM told me I was selected for Vice Prez post: Naidu
284.article_body: Outgoing Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Monday recalled the time when he was elected. "The day PM Narendra Modi told me that I was being selected to become the Vice President of India, I was in tears, I didn't ask for it," he said. Naidu added, "Tears were because I had to leave the party."

285.title: IIT Madras records highest number of job offers; highest salary offered ₹1.9 crore
285.article_body: At 1,199, IIT Madras has recorded its highest-ever number of job offers received during campus placements in the academic year 2021-22. While the average salary received by students during campus placements for 2021-22 is ₹21.48 lakh per annum. The highest salary offered was $250,000 (around ₹1.9 crore). Notably, 80% of the students who had registered received job offers.

286.title: HC allows 70-yr-old with brain disorder to have ultrasound at home
286.article_body: The Delhi HC has allowed a private hospital to transport an ultrasound machine to the house of a 70-year-old man suffering from a rare brain disorder. The court observed that the patient's right to life would be violated if provisions of the Pre-Natal Diagnostic Techniques (Prohibition of Sex Selection) Act, 1994, prevent him from accessing healthcare in his current condition.

287.title: Taliban blocking Germany's efforts to evacuate Afghans: Report
287.article_body: The Taliban are obstructing German government's efforts to evacuate former Afghan workers, political activists and others at risk, a report in news magazine Der Spiegel said. Germany planned to evacuate 7,700 people between July and mid-September, however, only 1,044 Afghans could be brought to the country in July. Germany said 10,000 Afghans who were promised evacuation are still in Afghanistan.

288.title: Indian TT player Gnanasekaran bags his 1st ever CWG singles medal, 6th overall
288.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sathiyan Gnanasekaran won his first-ever singles medal at CWG on Monday. The 29-year-old bagged bronze by defeating England's Paul Drinkhall at CWG 2022. Overall, it's Gnanasekaran's sixth CWG medal. He has bagged two men's team gold medals (2018 and 2022), two men's doubles silver medals (2018 and 2022) and a mixed doubles bronze medal (2018).

289.title: Scripbox acquires Pune-based advisory firm Wealth Managers
289.article_body: Bengaluru-based wealth management platform Scripbox has acquired Pune-based advisory firm Wealth Managers (India) Private Limited. Scripbox, which has been partnering with independent online and offline wealth managers, said the deal will help expand geographical presence and customer base. Wealth Managers aims to build long-term investments for larger cross section of investors through this deal.

290.title: Fire breaks out at garment store in Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta
290.article_body: A fire broke out at a garment store on the ground floor of a residential building in Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta in the early hours of Monday. Three fire tenders were rushed to the spot after the fire was reported at 8:30 am, fire officials informed. It reportedly took an hour for the fire to be brought under control.

291.title: The phenomenal Sindhu is champion of champions: PM Modi on her CWG gold
291.article_body: Congratulating PV Sindhu on winning her first-ever women's singles gold medal at CWG, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "The phenomenal @Pvsindhu1 is a champion of champions! She repeatedly shows what excellence is all about. Her dedication and commitment is awe-inspiring." He added, "Congratulations to her on winning the gold medal at the CWG. Wishing her the best for her future endeavours."

292.title: BJP MLA Raja Singh to hold 'Tiranga bike rally' in Hyd on August 12
292.article_body: Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh announced on Monday that he would be holding a 'Tiranga bike rally' in Hyderabad on August 12 to mark 75 years of India's independence. The rally will cover a route from the Akashpuri Hanuman temple at Dhoolpet to the BJP state office. It will pass through Jummerat Bazaar, Begum Bazaar Chatri and Siddiamber Bazaar.

293.title: Hyd Police arrest man for illegally transporting 8 cows without food, free air
293.article_body: Hyderabad's Pahadishareef Police arrested a 30-year-old man for illegally transporting eight cows in a cruel manner, without providing them with food and free air. The accused revealed that he purchased a vehicle last year and bought cattle from the Vijayawada cattle market and transported them to slaughter houses in Hyderabad, said M Kashi Vishwanath, Inspector Pahadishareef police station.

294.title: You created magic on court: Prez Murmu to Sindhu on her 1st CWG singles gold
294.article_body: After Indian shuttler PV Sindhu won her first-ever gold medal in singles at CWG, President Droupadi Murmu tweeted, "Sindhu has won the nation's heart by winning a historic badminton gold at Commonwealth Games. You created magic on the court, enthralling millions." She added, "Your masterly win makes our Tiranga fly high and our national anthem resonate at Birmingham."

295.title: Amit Shah, Dharmendra Pradhan participate in ‘Tiranga Yatra’
295.article_body: Ahead of 75th Independence Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan participated in the 'Tiranga Yatra' in Odisha’s Cuttack. BJP workers welcomed the duo at the Bhubaneswar airport by holding banners and placards with pictures of the ministers on them. They also went to Shree Lingaraj temple to offer prayers.

296.title: UP Minister, who 'disappeared' with case file, gets bail after surrendering
296.article_body: A cabinet minister in the Yogi Adityanath government, Rakesh Sachan, was sentenced to one year of imprisonment with a fine of ₹1,500 in an Arms Act case after he surrendered before a court on Monday. However, he was later granted bail on a bond of ₹50,000. A day ago, police had launched an enquiry into his "disappearance" from the courtroom.

297.title: SRK, Hirani were not happy with 'Dunki' photo leaks: Taapsee
297.article_body: After some pictures from the sets of 'Dunki' surfaced online, Taapsee Pannu said both Shah Rukh Khan and the film's director Rajkumar Hirani were not happy with the leaks. "But we were shooting at Westminster Bridge (London), there is only so much you can do," she added. Taapsee further said Rajkumar wanted to reveal the details after finishing the film.

298.title: Such statement can’t be appreciated by anyone: Bar Council on Sibal’s remark
298.article_body: Following Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal’s "no hope left" in Supreme Court remark, Bar Council of India Chairman MK Mishra said, "I don't think such a statement can be appreciated by anyone." He added, "He was practicing law for a long time…now at this stage when he has lost a few cases, blaming entire judicial system isn't proper."

299.title: PM Modi condoles deaths in Khatu Shyamji stampede
299.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has expressed deep grief over the loss of lives in a stampede at the Khatu Shyamji Temple in Rajasthan. He also wished a speedy recovery to those injured in the incident. “Saddened by the loss of lives due to stampede. My thoughts are with the bereaved families. I pray for those who are injured,” said PM.

300.title: Jamshedpur couple found murdered, 15-yr-old daughter goes missing
300.article_body: A couple was found dead at their home in Manifit in Jamshedpur, Jharkhand. The deceased, identified as Bhupendra Mandal (39) and Sabita Devi (35), are suspected to have been murdered and a family feud seems to be the cause behind it, police said. Meanwhile, the couple's 15-year-old daughter is missing and a search is on to find her, police added.

301.title: One of the first grain ships to leave Ukraine arrives in Turkey
301.article_body: One of the first grain ships to leave Ukraine, Polarnet, arrived in Turkey on Monday. "[The ship's arrival] sends a message...to every family in the Middle East, Africa, and Asia: Ukraine won't abandon you," Ukrainian Foreign Affairs Minister Dmytro Kuleba tweeted. The first ship that left Ukraine, Razoni, still hasn't reached its destination in Lebanon, according to Marine Traffic website.

302.title: 20-year-old shuttler Lakshya Sen wins India's 20th gold medal at CWG 2022
302.article_body: India's 20-year-old shuttler Lakshya Sen defeated Malaysia's Ng Tze Yong in the men's singles final to bag India's 20th gold at CWG 2022. This is the first time in CWG history that India bagged both men's singles and women's singles gold in badminton in the same edition. PV Sindhu had beaten Michelle Li of Canada to bag women's singles gold.

303.title: Meta testing live streaming platform for influencers called 'Super': Report
303.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta is testing a new live streaming platform for influencers called 'Super', according to a report by Business Insider. Super allows influencers to host livestreams, earn revenue and engage with viewers. Meta has reportedly paid influencers between $200 to $3,000 to use the platform for 30 minutes. Super reportedly looks to have similar functionality to Twitch.

304.title: Institutions shouldn't be denigrated: Jethmalani on Sibal’s remark on SC
304.article_body: Following Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal’s "no hope left" in the Supreme Court remark, senior advocate and Rajya Sabha MP Mahesh Jethmalani said he is "surprised". "Judgements can be criticised but institutions shouldn't be denigrated," Jethmalani added. "He must be speaking for small group of people who expect the Supreme Court to give decisions as per them," he stated.

305.title: Rajinikanth meets Tamil Nadu Governor, says 'discussed politics'
305.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth met Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi at Raj Bhavan in Chennai on Monday. Rajinikanth said they discussed politics, adding that he could not reveal the details. "I spoke for about 25-30 minutes with him. He had spent the majority of his time in the north...He loves Tamil Nadu and the people here," Rajinikanth added.

306.title: Angered by horrific killings of 4 Muslim men in Albuquerque: Biden
306.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday said that he was angered and saddened by the "horrific killings" of four Muslim men in New Mexico's Albuquerque. Earlier, the state's governor Michelle Lujan Grisham had called the attacks "targeted killings". Biden added that his administration "stands strongly" with the Muslim community. "These hateful attacks have no place in America," he further said.

307.title: Bulldozer action only for show: Priyanka on Noida demolition
307.article_body: Congress’ Priyanka Gandhi Vadra reacted to Noida administration demolishing illegal construction at the residence of Shrikant Tyagi, who identifies himself on social media as national executive member of BJP’s Kisan Morcha. "Bulldozer action is only for show," she tweeted. "Didn't BJP government know for so many years that construction undertaken by Noida BJP leader was illegal? Priyanka asked.

308.title: Affront to sacred institution of Parliament: Cong leader on ED summon to Kharge
308.article_body: Days after ED summoned Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge, party leader Jairam Ramesh on Monday said it was an "affront" to sacred institution of Parliament. "In such matters, issuing of summons by ED or any law enforcing agencies to any MP much less the LoP when Parliament is in session, is outright affront to sacred institution of Parliament and parliamentarians," Ramesh added.

309.title: JioGenNext helped 170 startups that raised ₹2,600 cr to date: RIL
309.article_body: In its annual report for financial year 2021-22, Reliance Industries said JioGenNext has supported 170 startups that collectively secured over ₹2,600 crore in early-stage venture capital since 2014. JioGenNext was founded to help early-stage startups and has Reliance's top management members as mentors. In 2021-22, JioGenNext launched Market Access Program (MAP) with 11 high potential startups.

310.title: 3 arrested for cheating 49-yr-old Mumbai woman of ₹4.64 lakh
310.article_body: Mumbai Police has arrested three persons from the Delhi-Hapur highway for allegedly cheating a 49-year-old woman of over ₹4.64 lakh. The accused posed as bank executives and asked the victim for her details to update her KYC information. They then changed the woman's online banking passwords and details and issued a virtual credit card in her name.

311.title: Iranian police arrest Afghan man suspected of stabbing 10 to death
311.article_body: Iranian police have arrested an Afghan national who is suspected of stabbing 10 people to death in a village following a quarrel over land, state media IRNA reported on Monday. Four Iranians and six Afghan nationals were killed in the incident and one farm worker was injured, the report added. The accused was reportedly mentally unstable.

312.title: At least spare Ayodhya: SP to BJP after MLA named in illegal land trade case
312.article_body: The Samajwadi Party (SP) criticised BJP after Mayor Rishikesh Upadhyay and BJP MLA Ved Prakash Gupta were named among 40 people accused of illegally trading plots and building infrastructure by the Ayodhya Development Authority. "We have said it before and are repeating it again: The corrupt of BJP, at least spare Ayodhya," tweeted SP chief Akhilesh Yadav.

313.title: China's military drills continue around Taiwan
313.article_body: China said on Monday that it is continuing military drills in the seas and skies around Taiwan. People's Liberation Army's (PLA) Eastern Theatre Command said on Chinese social media platform Weibo that it will practice conducting anti-submarine attacks and sea raids. China started carrying out military drills in retaliation to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan.

314.title: 3 banks allegedly put loans given to SpiceJet in 'high-risk' category; airline responds
314.article_body: IDFC First Bank, Yes Bank and state-owned Indian Bank have reportedly put loans issued to SpiceJet in the high-risk category. As per a report, the lenders are concerned about the airline's cash flows as it is behind on payments to some aircraft lessors. Meanwhile, SpiceJet denied the report and said, "Loans are being serviced as per the agreed terms."

315.title: Hong Kong to cut COVID-19 hotel quarantine to 3 days from Aug 12
315.article_body: Hong Kong will cut the COVID-19 hotel quarantine period to three days from August 12, Chief Executive John Lee has announced. Following the hotel quarantine, travellers will undergo another four days of "medical surveillance" either at home or at any hotel. "We need to balance between people's livelihood and...competitiveness of Hong Kong to give...community maximum momentum," Lee said.

316.title: Baidu's EV arm's autonomous driving tech will be ahead of Tesla: CEO
316.article_body: The autonomous driving technology of Baidu's electric vehicle (EV) firm Jidu Auto will be one-generation ahead of Tesla, Baidu CEO Robin Li said. "Our understanding of smart vehicles is that being electric is the semi-final while being intelligent is the final," Li added. Jidu's first "robot" concept car, released in June, has two lidars while Tesla doesn't use lidar sensors.

317.title: China extends lockdown in Hainan province amid COVID outbreak
317.article_body: Authorities in China's Hainan province locked down more areas on Monday. The island province, located in the South China Sea, reported more than 1,500 domestically transmitted cases of COVID-19 this month including 1,000 symptomatic ones. This is the biggest outbreak in Hainan since the virus was first reported in Wuhan in late 2019.

318.title: 3-year-old in coma after dad thrashes her for playing for too long in Hyd
318.article_body: A three-year-old girl is in a coma at a hospital in Hyderabad after she was thrashed by her father for spending too much time in the washroom and playing with water, police said. "The girl is in a coma and admitted to Osmania [General] Hospital after the father threw her on floor. We have taken him into custody," police added.

319.title: Former Coal Secretary sentenced to three year imprisonment
319.article_body: A special CBI court has sentenced three years in prison to former Coal Secretary HC Gupta after it found anomalies in the allocation of a coal block in Maharashtra. The court also awarded former Joint Secretary KS Kropha to two years in prison and Director of Grace Industries Mukesh Gupta to four years in the coal scam case.

320.title: Don't know who has spoken about it: Arslan on wedding rumours with Sussanne
320.article_body: Arslan Goni has reacted to reports that claimed he's planning to tie the knot with Sussanne Khan. He said he doesn't like to talk about his personal life, adding, "I don't know who's spoken about it...I don't know who's written about it." "Why don't these 'sources' tell me more about it?" Arslan said. Sussanne was earlier married to Hrithik Roshan.

321.title: Shekhar Kapur meets Rajamouli, calls him 'Golden Boy of Indian cinema'
321.article_body: Taking to Twitter, filmmaker Shekhar Kapur shared a picture with 'RRR' filmmaker SS Rajamouli. "What a wonderful day spent with the 'Golden Boy of Indian cinema' Rajamouli discussing filmmaking, philosophy, storytelling and technology," he tweeted. Shekhar further said that it was a learning experience. "Thank you and your family for your hospitality," Shekhar added.

322.title: Brilliance of Sindhu creates history once again: Anurag on shuttler's CWG gold
322.article_body: Congratulating two-time Olympic medallist shuttler PV Sindhu following her maiden gold medal at Commonwealth Games, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter and wrote, "The brilliance of Sindhu creates history once again. You had us glued to our TV screens!" He added, "What an amazing show of excellence and determination!" Sindhu beat Michelle Li of Canada 21-15, 21-13 in final.

323.title: UN chief calls for international access to Ukraine's nuclear plant
323.article_body: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres on Monday called for international inspectors to be granted access to Ukraine's nuclear power plant Zaporizhzhia. The request comes after Ukraine and Russia accused each other of shelling the facility. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has accused Russia of unleashing "nuclear terror" and called for global sanctions on Russia's nuclear sector.

324.title: Want to be in Akshay, Aamir's league; boycott my film too: Taapsee
324.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu and filmmaker Anurag Kashyap have reacted to the Twitter trends calling for the boycott of Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and Akshay Kumar's 'Raksha Bandhan'. "Please everyone boycott our film Dobaaraa...If actors like Aamir...Akshay are getting boycotted then I also want to be in that league," Taapsee said. "I want #BoycottKashyap to trend on Twitter," Anurag said.

325.title: 34-yr-old man arrested for having unnatural sex with cows in B'luru
325.article_body: A 34-year-old resident of Karnataka's Mandya has been arrested after being caught red-handed by his friend while having unnatural sex with cows in Bengaluru, police said on Monday. He'd travel to Bangalore University's Jnana Bharathi Campus, take cows grazing to isolated places and indulge in the crime. He was caught after his friend grew suspicious and began watching his movements.

326.title: Bullet train service suspended after theft of cables in Spain
326.article_body: Spain's state-owned rail operator Renfe said in a statement on Monday that it has suspended the bullet train between the country's capital city Madrid and the second largest city Barcelona due to the theft of cables. An alternate train route has been established between the two cities for travellers which will bypass the high-speed network, the company said.

327.title: 2 more grain ships depart from Ukraine as third port opens
327.article_body: Turkey and Ukraine said two more ships departed from Ukrainian Black Sea ports. Sacura is carrying 11,000 tonnes of soybeans to Italy and Arizona is carrying 48,458 tonnes of corn to Turkey, Turkish defence ministry said. The UN and Turkey brokered a deal between Ukraine and Russia after warnings that halt in grain shipments could result in severe food shortages.

328.title: Rajasthan CM's remarks distorted by BJP IT cell: Gehlot's aide
328.article_body: After Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot’s rape law remark triggered controversy, his close aide Shashi Kant Sharma defended him and accused BJP of distorting his comments. “His remark on increased crimes, rising unemployment has been presented in a distorted manner by the BJP IT cell. Similar observations have been previously made by police," said Sharma, officer on special duty to CM.

329.title: Zomato delivery boy mowed down in Delhi; kite string found stuck on his bike tyre
329.article_body: A 32-year-old Zomato delivery executive died in an accident on Sunday night near Tughlakabad metro station in Delhi. Police said they found a kite string stuck on his bike's tyre. "We suspect the string got tangled and he got confused. He fell on the road. Meanwhile, other vehicles plying on the road ran over him," police said.

330.title: Ranveer is the next superstar, he can do Simmba, Khilji, Bajirao: Rohit
330.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty has stated that actor Ranveer Singh is going to be the next superstar because he can perform in all genres. "He is a great actor who you can mould in any space. He can do Simmba, Cirkus, Khilji, Ram...or Bajirao," the filmmaker added. Rohit and Ranveer worked together in the upcoming film 'Cirkus'.

331.title: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde set to visit Nanded district
331.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde will be visiting Nanded today after Shiv Sena sacked district chief Umesh Munde and several other leaders for indulging in “anti-party activities”. Shinde faction, in June, rebelled against the Sena camp, leading to the fall of the 31-month-old Thackeray-led Maha Vikas Aghadi government. Shinde was sworn-in as the CM of Maharashtra on June 30.

332.title: Congress criticises ED sumons to Mallikarjun Kharge
332.article_body: The Congress party criticised Enforcement Directorate’s (ED) summons to Leader of Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge and called it an “outright affront” to the Parliament. “Issuing of summons by ED or any law-enforcing agencies to any MP [including] the Leader of Opposition when Parliament is in session, is an outright affront to the sacred institution,” said Congress leader Jairam Ramesh.

333.title: Delhi man dies of electric shock while charging an e-rickshaw
333.article_body: A 34-year-old man died while charging an e-rickshaw in Delhi's Nihal Vihar area on Saturday. He has been identified as Mahender, a resident of Indira Camp in Vikas Puri, police said, adding that he worked at an e-rickshaw charging garage. Mahender died due to electric shock., the police added.

334.title: Contemptuous, unfortunate: AIBA on Kapil Sibal's remark on SC
334.article_body: All India Bar Association (AIBA) Chairman Adish Aggarwala criticised Rajya Sabha MP and senior advocate Kapil Sibal for saying that he has no hope left in the Supreme Court and termed his remark as "contemptuous" and "unfortunate". "If cases haven't been decided in favour of Kapil Sibal, it does not mean that the judicial system has failed," the chairman said.

335.title: Non-bailable warrant issued against UP minister for inciting mob in 2015
335.article_body: The Chief Judicial Magistrate (CJM) Court of Gorakhpur has issued a non-bailable warrant against UP Cabinet Minister Sanjay Nishad for inciting a mob. The case is related to an agitation that took place in 2015, where he and his supporters were demanding reservation for Nishads when a ruckus broke out and a person died in the incident.

336.title: Shiv Sena MP Raut sent to judicial custody till August 22
336.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has been sent to judicial custody till August 22 in a money laundering case. He was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) last Sunday. The probe agency has claimed that some of the properties bought by Raut involved substantial cash transactions. The ED has also questioned Raut’s wife in connection with the same case.

337.title: Vishwa Sanatan Parishad demands demolition of B'luru's Idgah Maidan tower
337.article_body: Vishwa Sanatan Parishad President Bhaskaran on Monday said the organisation will write to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike and the state government and file a petition to take down Idgah Maidan tower. "If Idgah tower is allowed to stand there, which is now revenue department's property, it'll...lead to communal clashes," he said. Tower must be demolished in society's interest, he added.

338.title: Man caught with Bluetooth speakers during civil service exam in Pune
338.article_body: A 30-year-old man was caught using banned electronic devices at a Maharashtra Public Service Commission (MPSC) exam venue in Pune and was later arrested for violating norms prescribed by the commission. The aspirant was caught carrying a mobile phone and Bluetooth micro speakers inside the examination hall. He has been booked under the relevant sections of the IPC.

339.title: Dharma didn't tell me before using my vocals in 'Nach Punjaban': Gippy
339.article_body: Punjabi actor-singer Gippy Grewal has revealed that Dharma Productions did not inform him before using his vocals in the 'JugJugg Jeeyo' song 'The Punjaabban Song'. "Nobody called me for three months...I assumed...they didn't use it...They had obviously used it...Their entire promotion was based on the song, nobody said who sang it. I don't know what competition they had," he added.

340.title: Rise of elements like PFI in Rajasthan has CM's blessing: Rathore
340.article_body: BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore has said that the alleged rise of extremist elements, including the Popular Front of India (PFI), in Rajasthan has the blessing of CM Ashok Gehlot. Reacting to Gehlot's statement on the increase in rape incidents, Rathore added, "State government is trying to hide their failures in stopping the increasing [rape] incidents [by giving such statements]."

341.title: Neighbour repeatedly rapes 15-year-old girl in Pune, arrested
341.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a rape accused for allegedly sexually assaulting his 15-year-old neighbour on several occasions. According to the complaint, the accused had allegedly barged inside the girl's house and assaulted her for the first time in February. In July, the accused and his friend also allegedly abducted the girl and kept her hostage in Mumbai.

342.title: Devotees offer prayers on last 'Sawan Monday' across country
342.article_body: On the fourth and last Monday in the holy month of Sawan, devotees visited temples across the country to offer their prayers. Sawan is considered to be the most auspicious month for devotees. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva who is worshipped during this month. The worshippers observe fast on each Mondays which fall in Sawan month.

343.title: India's Yastika falls while walking out to bat during CWG cricket final, video goes viral
343.article_body: A video has gone viral showing India's Yastika Bhatia tripping on advertising boards and falling while walking out to bat during the CWG women's cricket final against Australia. In the video, her teammates can be seen laughing in the dugout as she falls. Yastika was included in playing XI as concussion substitute for Taniya Bhatia, who was hit on helmet.

344.title: Shoaib Akhtar undergoes his 6th knee surgery, shares video from hospital bed
344.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar underwent his sixth knee surgery in Melbourne. He took to Instagram to share a video from the hospital bed, revealing the surgery took around 5-6 hours to complete. "Hopefully...it's my last surgery...Even after 11 years since retiring...I'm in pain," he said. He added that he could have played more cricket if not for his knee issues.

345.title: SoftBank posts record quarterly loss of $23 billion as tech stocks tumble
345.article_body: SoftBank Group has reported a record loss for the second straight quarter amid a selloff in global tech stocks. The Japanese conglomerate's net loss for the quarter ended June stood at 3.16 trillion yen ($23.4 billion). Meanwhile, its Vision Fund unit posted a quarterly loss of 2.33 trillion yen ($17.23 billion). SoftBank has backed several Indian startups, like Paytm, PolicyBazaar.

346.title: In my head, I've slept with hundreds of women: Elon Musk's 76-year-old father
346.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 76-year-old father Errol remarked, "In my head, I've slept with hundreds of women. Occasionally I find a woman that is attracted to me." He also denied being a serial womaniser. Errol had recently revealed that he had a second child with his 35-year-old stepdaughter Jana Bezuidenhout in 2019 and that they are not living together anymore.

347.title: We made mistakes in final few overs: Harmanpreet after CWG final loss vs Aus
347.article_body: After India Women won the silver medal following their nine-run loss against Australia in gold medal match at CWG 2022, India skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said her side made some mistakes in the final few overs of the match. "We had full control of the game...should've been more calculated," she added. Chasing 162, India were dismissed for 152 in 19.3 overs.

348.title: 21-yr-old sailor cheated of ₹1.46 lakh in job fraud scam in Mumbai
348.article_body: A 21-year-old sailor of the Indian Coast Guard (ICG) was cheated in a social media job fraud scam on Friday, while he was admitted to INHS Asvini military hospital in Mumbai's Colaba. The sailor, in his complaint, revealed that he received a link on Telegram, following which he was asked to pay money to secure a part-time job.

349.title: UP man argues about water priced at ₹20 & not ₹15, thrown off moving train
349.article_body: A man from Jhansi was thrown off a running train in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur after he got into an argument with pantry staff over the price of a water bottle. In his complaint, the man said that he got into an argument with a vendor selling bottled water for ₹20, while the railways has fixed the price at ₹15.

350.title: upGrad raises $210 mn in funding led by ETS Global, Bodhi Tree
350.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad has secured $210 million funding at $2.25 billion valuation. upGrad founders invested $12.5 million in this funding round to maintain their ownership of the edtech startup over 50%.
