The round was led by ETS Global and Bodhi Tree and saw participation of Kaizen Management Advisors along with existing investors like International Finance Corporation and Temasek.

351.title: IMD issues orange alert for Mumbai, SEOC asks citizens to stay home
351.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert in Mumbai as the city is expected to receive very heavy rainfall in the coming week. The State Emergency Operation Center (SEOC) has asked citizens not to leave their houses unless necessary and follow instructions from the local government administration. Mumbai will remain on orange alert from Monday till Wednesday.

352.title: BJP MLA, Mayor among 40 people accused of illegally selling plots in Ayodhya
352.article_body: Ayodhya Mayor Rishikesh Upadhyay and BJP MLA Ved Prakash Gupta are among 40 people accused of illegally selling plots and building infrastructure in the city. The mayor and the MLA have alleged foul play in the list of alleged offenders released by the Ayodhya Development Authority.  Former BJP MLA Gorakhnath Baba is also among the accused persons.

353.title: Woman dead after 19-yr-old driving Jaguar rams into her in Kolkata; CCTV video surfaces
353.article_body: A 45-year-old female pedestrian died allegedly after a 19-year-old driving a Jaguar car rammed into her in Kolkata. A CCTV footage of the incident has also surfaced online, which shows the speeding vehicle hitting her. The accused had hit two other cars before crashing into the woman, reports quoting eyewitnesses stated.

354.title: Father, sons kill Bihar man for stealing iron rods from shop in B'luru
354.article_body: A father-son duo has been arrested for allegedly killing a construction worker from Bihar for stealing iron rods from their shop in Bengaluru. After catching the victim red-handed, the accused hit him with iron rods and assaulted him, leading to his death. The father was later detained and confessed his second son was also involved in assaulting the victim.

355.title: 15-yr-old killed in cloudburst in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba; houses vacated
355.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was killed after cloudbursts struck at least two villages, Bhadoga and Kandhwara, in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba district. The Chamba District Emergency Operation Centre (DEOC) said that the villages were hit by sudden heavy rains in the intervening night of Sunday and Monday. Some houses were also vacated and people were shifted to safer places.

356.title: Delhi man kidnapped, assaulted for failing to repay ₹20 Lakh
356.article_body: A Delhi businessman was allegedly abducted and manhandled after he allegedly failed to repay a loan of ₹20 lakh, taken from a money lending firm, police said on Sunday. The victim claimed the accused barged into his office and assaulted him. He alleged the accused abducted him and later dropped him outside his office, said Amrutha Guguloth, DCP (New Delhi).

357.title: No hope left in SC, sensitive cases assigned to only certain judges: Sibal
357.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP and senior advocate Kapil Sibal criticised some of the recent judgements passed by the Supreme Court and said that "sensitive cases" are assigned to only selective judges adding that he has "no hope left" in the institution. "I am saying this after completing 50 years of practising in the Supreme Court," Sibal added.

358.title: NMMC forms 75 with vehicles to mark 75 years of India's independence
358.article_body: Different departments of the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) are forming the number 75 as part of the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav campaign. Vehicles from NMMC's fleet were displayed at Belapur Jetty in the shape of number 75 to celebrate 75 years of the nation's independence. Earlier, Gujarat students made a human formation of the number 75.

359.title: PV Sindhu wins her first-ever CWG gold medal in singles
359.article_body: Two-time Olympic medal-winning shuttler PV Sindhu on Monday bagged her first-ever CWG gold medal in singles. The 27-year-old defeated Michelle Li of Canada 21-15, 21-13 in the women's singles final at CWG 2022 in Birmingham. It is Sindhu's third singles medal at CWG after her silver at 2018 Gold Coast Games and bronze at 2014 Glasgow Games.

360.title: Rajasthan can't stop crime against women: BJP leader after MP alleges attack
360.article_body: After BJP MP Ranjeeta Koli claimed she was attacked by mining mafia, BJP MP Jaskaur Meena said Rajasthan government cannot stop crime against women. The incident was reported from Bharatpur. "CM gives statements in interest of criminals," Meena added. "Our MP's life [is] under threat. I've given a Zero Hour notice…will take up this matter in the House," Meena stated.

361.title: Former Haitian senator killed by gangs amid a spike in violence
361.article_body: Amid a spike in violence in Haiti's capital city Port-au-Prince, the Caribbean country's PM Ariel Henry said on Sunday that former senator Yvon Buissereth was killed by gangs in the capital's Laboule area. Yvon was killed while police battled with gangs, reported Reuters. "[Yvon's] killers, as well as...all other criminals who sow mourning...will be fully prosecuted," Haitian PM Henry said.

362.title: Woman hit by goods train at B'luru station; given first aid, hospitalised
362.article_body: A woman was allegedly hit by a goods train at Bengaluru's Yelahanka Railway Station on Sunday. Staff from the Railway Protection Force (RPF) gave the injured woman first aid treatment and then shifted her to a hospital for further treatment. Reports said that it is not yet clear how the injury occurred.

363.title: She's so much like Ranbir in a sense: Alia Bhatt on Neetu Kapoor
363.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, speaking about her mother-in-law Neetu Kapoor, has said that the veteran actress is "so much like" Ranbir Kapoor. "She is so supportive, she's so positive and at the same time, she really lets you be," Alia stated. "Even during my wedding, my friends were like 'Oh my god, your mother-in-law is...outstanding, she's so cool'," Alia added.

364.title: I sulk, cry, do things that normal humans do: Kriti on films failing
364.article_body: Speaking about her reaction to her films failing at box office, actress Kriti Sanon said that she sulks, cries and does things "normal human beings do". She added that she gets defensive about certain films because she is close to them. "But I have to move on...there's nothing more you can do as an actor beyond a point," Kriti said.

365.title: He is man of great humility: Seth on Letterman coming as 'Late Night' guest
365.article_body: Seth Meyers revealed that David Letterman was nervous when the latter returned to the 'Late Night' show as a guest. "He is forever a man of great humility...it's shocking to me that I was in a position to tell Letterman, 'Yeah, you're doing great. Don't worry, Letterman, you are on a talk show and you're doing great'," Seth stated.

366.title: Apple asks suppliers to avoid 'Made in Taiwan' labels on shipments to China: Report
366.article_body: Apple has reportedly asked its Taiwan-based suppliers to ensure shipments to China don't carry the label 'Made in Taiwan', in a bid to avoid disruptions from Chinese customs inspections after the visit of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to Taipei. The report stated that Apple asked manufacturers to label components as "Chinese Taipei" or "Taiwan, China".

367.title: Ashamed to say it's our govt: BJP MP video on Noida chaos tweeted by Congress
367.article_body: Congress shared a video of BJP MP Mahesh Sharma publicly expressing his anger over the chaos created by supporters of Shrikant Tyagi in Noida's housing society, where the woman who was abused and assaulted by Tyagi lives. In the video, Sharma can be heard saying, "We are ashamed to say that it's our government here...There can't be anything more shameful."

368.title: Wife, granddaughter of retired constable killed in Meerut; robbery suspected
368.article_body: The wife of a retired head constable and their 12-year-old granddaughter were killed by unknown person in Meerut's Shastri Nagar area on Sunday, police said. The matter came to light after the neighbours informed the police that the house remained closed since morning and nobody came out. It seems that they were killed during a robbery attempt, the police claimed.

369.title: ₹25,000 cash prize announced on arrest of Shrikant Tyagi who assaulted a woman in Noida
369.article_body: The Commissionerate of Gautam Buddha Nagar, Uttar Pradesh on Monday announced a cash prize of ₹25,000 to the person who helps with the arrest of politician Shrikant Tyagi, who is accused of assaulting a woman in a housing society in Noida. This comes after Noida administration demolished the illegal construction at Tyagi's residence earlier today.

370.title: Rajasthan at number one for rapes in India: BJP's Rajyavardhan Rathore
370.article_body: BJP leader Rajyavardhan Rathore on Monday said that people in Rajasthan are scared and CM Ashok Gehlot is giving new statements in defence of rapists. "Rajasthan [is at] number one for rapes in the country," Rathore added. Earlier, Gehlot had said, "Incidents of murder after rape have increased due to the law on the hanging of culprits after Nirbhaya case."

371.title: Bihar leader RCP Singh in touch with JD(U) MLAs amid tension with BJP: Report
371.article_body: After Bihar leader RCP Singh resigned from the Janta Dal (United), he is in touch with several party MLAs, reports said. Meanwhile, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has asked all MLAs of the Janata Dal (United) to be present in Patna by Monday evening. This comes amid speculations of 'split' between the Janata Dal (United) and the Bharatiya Janta Party.

372.title: Shooting takes place outside a bar in US' Cincinnati; 9 injured
372.article_body: At least nine people were injured in a shooting outside a bar in US' Cincinnati on Sunday, police said. A police officer fired one round at a suspect, who then fled the spot, a police official said. The police, however, believe that there were two shooters as more shots were fired after the first suspect fled, the police official added.

373.title: Katrina's 'Merry Christmas' shoot location changed days after fire at Chitrakoot
373.article_body: The location of Katrina Kaif-starrer 'Merry Christmas' has been changed to Vrindavan studio days after a fire gutted Chitrakoot studio leaving one dead. Director Luv Ranjan's untitled film starring Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor was being shot on the now-gutted set. 'Merry Christmas' producer Ramesh Taurani said that they have dismantled their film's set from Chitrakoot studio.

374.title: Shah Rukh is my favourite co-star, can't wait to work with him again: Alia
374.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that actor Shah Rukh Khan is her favourite co-star, adding that she cannot wait to get back on set with him again. The two shared screen space in 2016 film 'Dear Zindagi' and produced 2022 film 'Darlings' together. "Unfortunately, we...haven't been approached by the same filmmaker but I'm hopeful it'll happen soon," Alia added.

375.title: Pic of India men's team watching India women's CWG final vs Australia goes viral
375.article_body: A photo of India men's team watching India women's final against Australia in the Commonwealth Games' first-ever cricket event is going viral on social media. "Nail-biter at Edgbaston. Senior men's team following #TeamIndia's progress," the team had captioned the picture. India bagged silver medal while Australia won gold in the event.

376.title: Your one-liners are win-liners: PM Modi to outgoing Vice President Naidu
376.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday thanked outgoing Rajya Sabha Chairman and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu at the conclusion of his tenure. PM Modi said, "This is a very emotional moment for this House." He added, "Your one-liners are wit-liners. They are win-liners too. It means nothing more needs to be said after those lines."

377.title: Amazon-iRobot deal might face anti-trust review by US FTC: Experts
377.article_body: Amazon's decision to move ahead with its acquisition of iRobot Corp for $1.7 billion is likely to face scrutiny from the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC), experts said. Amazon's $3.49 billion deal to buy 1Life Healthcare is already being probed. The FTC, under Chair Lina Khan, has been pushed to take a harder look at acquisitions by big tech firms.

378.title: Self-styled godman claiming to be reincarnation of goddess Kali absconding
378.article_body: A self-styled godman who claimed to be a reincarnation of goddess Kali is currently absconding from Uttar Pradesh, police stated on Monday. The accused, identified as Mukesh, claimed that he has supernatural powers to cure cancer and infertility among other diseases. Mukesh has cheated thousands of people and would organise healing darbars at night at a temple near Varanasi.

379.title: Nitish Kumar calls JD(U) MLAs to Patna amid reports of split with BJP
379.article_body: Amid speculation of 'split' with Bharatiya Janata Party, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has asked all MLAs of the Janata Dal (United) to be present in Patna by Monday evening. "Two conspiracies were hatched against Nitish Kumar in recent times...Chirag model of 2020...was responsible for bringing down our Assembly seats to 43," JD(U) National President Lalan Singh had earlier said.

380.title: We aren't targeting any community through 'Hum Do...': Director
380.article_body: 'Hum Do Hamare Baarah' director Kamal Chandra has said that the poster of the film is not objectionable at all. "We assure you that we aren't targeting any one particular community through our film," the director said. "Population explosion is a very serious issue that is bugging our country for a long time," he added. The film features Annu Kapoor.

381.title: Climate change making prediction difficult for weather agencies: IMD DG
381.article_body: Climate change has hampered the ability of forecasting agencies to accurately predict weather, India Meteorological Department (IMD) DG Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said. He further informed that IMD is installing more radars and upgrading its high-performance computing system to meet the challenge. The impact-based forecast will improve to become "more granular, specific and accurate" by 2025, he added.

382.title: 1 lakh tourists stranded in China's Hainan amid COVID-19 outbreak
382.article_body: Almost 1 lakh tourists are expected to remain stranded in China's Hainan for at least a week amid a coronavirus outbreak. This comes as China locked down more areas in Hainan on Monday, according to state media. "We just hope it won’t turn into another Shanghai," a tourist said referring to Shanghai's two-month lockdown, which was lifted in June.

383.title: Paytm shares gain 6% as Q1 net loss narrows to ₹644 crore
383.article_body: One97 Communications Ltd, Paytm's parent company, saw its shares surge nearly 6% on Monday. The development comes after it reported a net loss of ₹644.4 crore in the quarter that ended in June, as compared to net loss of ₹761.4 crore recorded in previous three months. Rise in subscription revenue, growth in bill payments helped narrow the loss, Paytm said.

384.title: We are the single largest party in Bihar: RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha
384.article_body: MP Manoj Kumar Jha has stated that Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) is the single largest party in Bihar. He further said that RJD can't see elements of instability in the state, adding that Bihar will decide what is best for it. His statement comes amid reports of Janata Dal (United) talking about splitting up with the BJP in the state.

385.title: Rohit drives buggy on ground with teammates on it to celebrate series win, video viral
385.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain Rohit Sharma driving a buggy on the ground carrying his teammates to celebrate 4-1 T20I series win against West Indies has gone viral. In the video, spectators can be heard cheering for Team India while the players take a victory lap on the buggy. The final match took place in Florida.

386.title: WWII bomb found in dried-up Italian river detonated; video surfaces
386.article_body: Italian army on Sunday detonated a World War II bomb, which was found in dried-up River Po, in a controlled explosion on Sunday. A video of the incident has surfaced online. The bomb was found on the river bank by fishermen "due to...decrease in water levels caused by drought", a colonel said. About 3,000 people were evacuated, the army said.

387.title: Rubbish batting, no common sense: Azharuddin after India women win silver at CWG
387.article_body: After India bagged silver medal while Australia won gold in the first-ever women's cricket event at CWG, Mohammed Azharuddin tweeted, "Rubbish batting by the Indian team. No common sense. Gave away a winning game." Australia had posted a total of 161/8 in their 20 overs before dismissing India for 152 runs. India lost its last eight wickets for 34 runs.

388.title: I meant illegally hot: Seema Sajdeh on calling 'Liger' song 'nonsense'
388.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Seema Sajdeh has clarified why she called Ananya Panday's song from her upcoming film 'Liger' "nonsense" on Instagram after the actress posted the song. Ananya posted pictures from the shoot of the song 'Aafat'. To this, Seema commented, "What nonsense...that means illegally hot!" Ananya's mother Bhavana also featured in 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives'.

389.title: Parents held after 5-yr-old's death in Maha; videos of them beating her found
389.article_body: Three people including the father and the mother of a five-year-old girl have been arrested following the child's death. Police said that the parents had brought the child's body to a hospital in Maharashtra's Nagpur but had run away from there. "During the investigation, we found some videos...where the daughter was being beaten by them," police said.

390.title: 900-year-old China's longest wooden arch bridge collapses in fire, pic surfaces
390.article_body: A 900-year-old wooden arch bridge known as the Wan'an bridge in East China's Fujian caught fire on Saturday night and collapsed. The Wan'an bridge, also known as the Bridge of Universal Peace, was China's longest wooden arch bridge ranging 98.2 metres. The Wan'an bridge was on the preliminary list of China's World Cultural Heritage sites in 2012.

391.title: Govt shouldn’t force policies on state govts: Mamata at NITI Aayog meet
391.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday said the Centre should look into the demands of state governments "more seriously" and no policies should be forced on them. While addressing a meeting of the Governing Council of the NITI Aayog in New Delhi, Banerjee stated that there should be greater cooperation between the Centre and state governments, according to reports.

392.title: Won't let accused walk free: UP Deputy CM after politician abused woman in Noida
392.article_body: After Shrikant Tyagi, who identifies himself on social media as national executive member of BJP's Kisan Morcha, abused and assaulted a woman in Noida, UP Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak said CM Yogi Adityanath has taken cognisance of the whole case. "We'll not let the accused walk free. Strict action will be taken against those who break the law," Pathak added.

393.title: 7-yr-old girl eats chocolate with wrapper, dies of cardiac arrest in K'taka
393.article_body: A 7-year-old girl, who passed away after eating a chocolate without removing its wrapper, suffered a cardiac arrest and did not choke to death, police said. The girl was waiting to board her school bus on July 20 when she collapsed and died. The victim's family members underwent medical tests showing that they have a genetic heart-related problem, police stated.

394.title: Reliance Chairman Mukesh Ambani draws NIL salary for 2nd year in a row
394.article_body: Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani drew no salary for the second year in a row in 2021-22. The 65-year-old had voluntarily given up remuneration during the last fiscal in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. Ambani is the second richest person in Asia with a $90.5 billion fortune, per Bloomberg. Previously, his salary had been capped at ₹15 crore since 2008-09.

395.title: 'Mahabharat' will never let you down, you might let it down: Aamir Khan
395.article_body: Aamir Khan, speaking about 'Mahabharat', has said, "When you're making 'Mahabharat', you're not making a film, you're doing a yagna." Aamir stated 'Mahabharat' isn't a movie and it's much deeper. "So I'm not ready for that. I'm afraid to bring it out in the fore. 'Mahabharat' will never let you down, you might let it down," he added.

396.title: 73 families affected in Mumbai's Malad mishap get new homes
396.article_body: Seventy-three families, who got affected by the Malad building collapse incident in 2019, received possession of new homes after three years. The building collapse incident, which occurred in 2019 at Ambedkar Nagar in the Pimpripada area, killed several people. Out of the 156 affected families, BMC had already shifted 83 families in new homes before shifting the remaining 73 families.

397.title: Youth stabs friend in Bengaluru for refusing to buy him beer
397.article_body: A 23-year-old youth allegedly stabbed his friend for refusing to buy him a beer in Bengaluru and is currently absconding. The suspect and victim are close friends and do odd jobs. The victim had bought three beers and refused to purchase more saying he didn't have money, police said. The victim sustained a stab injury on his left thigh.

398.title: Aim to have 220 airports by 2030, 40 cr air travellers by 2027: Union Minister
398.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said the country’s civil aviation sector is set to see a phenomenal growth in terms of passengers, airports and aircraft, with the number of air travellers projected to touch 40 crore by 2027. "We intend to go to 220 airports by 2030," Scindia added. India is looking at close to 1,200 aircraft by 2027, Scindia stated.

399.title: Shivon has an IQ of 170, Elon on right track: Musk's father as Elon has kids with exec
399.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s father Errol in an interview commented, “Shivon has an IQ of about 170, Elon is on a right track there.” Recently, it was reported that Elon fathered two children last year with Shivon Zilis, a top executive at his artificial intelligence company Neuralink. Errol added that he and his son are attracted to intelligent women.

400.title: Men posing as police thrash, kill driver for refusal to pay fine in West Bengal
400.article_body: Two men posing as police personnel thrashed and killed a man driving a goods truck in West Bengal over refusal to pay a ₹5,000 fine. The accused had a fake police sticker on their bike. One of the victim's friends called police after which the accused were arrested. The victim was rushed to the hospital but succumbed to his injuries.

401.title: BJP MP alleges attack by mining mafia in Bharatpur, says 'I could've been killed'
401.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MP Ranjeeta Koli claimed she was attacked by mining mafia. The incident was reported from Rajasthan's Bharatpur. "I saw about 150 trucks that were overloaded. I tried to stop them but they [ran away]...they pelted stones. I could have been killed," Koli said. Following the incident, she went on a sit-in protest alleging lack of police action.

402.title: 18-yr-old man's body gets stuck in engine of train, gets dragged for 5km in UP
402.article_body: An 18-year-old man's body got stuck in the engine of a goods train and was dragged for around 5 kilometres on the Delhi-Howrah rail line on Sunday, officials said. On getting information about the body, the driver of the goods train stopped it near Sirathu railway station in Uttar Pradesh. The body was sent for post-mortem, officials added.

403.title: UK museum to return Benin Bronzes looted in 19th century to Nigeria
403.article_body: Horniman Museum and Gardens in UK's London on Sunday agreed to return a collection of Benin Bronzes to Nigeria. The artefacts were looted when the British military attacked Benin City in the 19th century. This comes after the museum received a formal request from Nigeria's National Commission for Museums and Monuments for the return of the artefacts earlier this year.

404.title: Musk's father denies saying he's 'not proud of him', says 'I love Elon'
404.article_body: Clarifying his remarks made during an interview on Australian radio, Tesla CEO Elon Musk's father Errol said that he didn’t say he was not proud of his son. Errol said that he had misinterpreted the question and said, "I'm very thankful for Elon's achievements…I love Elon." Elon reportedly texted his father to “please keep quiet” after his earlier remarks.
